The work here is aligned to business mandate of TBS Industry Solutions portfolio (next generation solutions anchored on 5G/IoT and data) and will work very closely with the internal and partner teams executing on the strategy to ensure a compelling benefits realization approach. The ideal candidate should have proven experience in technology and services industry with a focus on partner tactics, ecosystem enablement, and co-innovation models. 

 

What you’ll do in this role:

 

  • Role will be reporting directly to the Director of Emerging Tech Product due to the TELUS first/TELUS Business Solutions first framework impact of the assignment, role and outcome. 
  • Overall end-to-end enablement ownership of strategic partners (affiliate and ventures) with strong emphasis on managed services discipline and emerging technologies (anchored on 5G/IoT/Data and other new technology derivatives: business platforms, Industry 4.0 capabilities and others).
  • Manage planning, delivery and post-acquisition, post venture strategy development for targets of interest. 
  • Develop strategic, operational, financial and value stream enablement plans with program team and greater stakeholder group.
  • Develop competitive differentiation and benchmarking against TELUS\' competitors, as well as revenue acquisition, retention and amplification strategies. 
  • Develop forecasting revenues and units by product and customer segments aligned to target PLT owners. 
  • Develop, support execution of product/technology/services and operational roadmap for TELUS Partner Hub evolution
  • Develop, support execution of new product service introduction objectives 
  • Provide/lead internal & external processes innovation strategies to drive and improve customer experience for the TELUS Business Solutions
  • Provide product expertise to as well as lead national, cross-functional value chain team
  • Support development and implementation of industry-leading product & pricing strategies to maximize profit growth and retention
  • Support first year enablement of revenue and performance KPI before full on post-acquisition integration of before next round of TELUS Ventures funding
  • Optimize product profitability by establishing competitive price structures that capture value in the market, and meeting product and process rationalization and optimization targets
  • Manage the performance of Service Delivery for the Portfolio
  • Design scaling and transition strategy for affiliate and ventures pipeline for the greater TBS and TELUS organization.

 

       

      What you bring:

       

      • Experience in technology and services market research, focused on Partnership opportunity identification and Partner funnel development 
      • Experience building an ecosystem of strategic partners in support of new market development aligned to network effect (multi-sided networks).
      • Knowledge on sourcing and contracting partner, team agreements, contracting models and review process
      • Knowledge of contract strategy, pricing 101 and next generation multi-contract enablement
      • Service Integration & Management and integrated digital platforms and services strategy.
      • Affiliate management, ventures management from a concept and execution level. 
      • Technical background, possessing the ability to understand new market needs and identifying sound technology solutions / Partners that satisfy new market needs
      • Competitive understanding of core telco, 5G/IoT/data, value add services and next generation SaaS/ISV solutions
      • ISV ecosystem offerings in a sell to, sell with, sell through motion, and in context of co-innovation.
      • Project Management, Lean Methodology, Six Sigma and Process Efficiency Operationalization
      • Wireless / fixed broadband, Telecom and non-Telecom IT applications, systems, platforms and services
      • Engineering, IT or related technical degree with MBA preferred, or MBA with strong technical background and demonstrated experience/competence working with IP, wireless and related technologies, or 5+ years business background in a technology industry with relevant experience in a product management or development role.
      • Marketing, Business, Technical or Management certifications and/or professional designation (PMP, CSM, CPM, etc), will be an asset


       

      You’re the missing piece of the puzzle with:

       

      • Analytical and financial acumen skills; business analysis, analytics and process engineering
      • Knowledge of marketing principles and the relationships between pricing, share, value propositions, and demand drivers 
      • Superior research and presentation skills with the ability to present strategic options in a clear concise manner
      • Entrepreneurial spirit which will drive passionate ownership, process improvement and accountability for the product/portfolio 
      • Strong consulting, solution development competencies in various technologies, services and industries. Emphasis on 3rd wave and Industry 4.0 solutions.  
      • Business and enterprise architecture and design
      • Entrepreneurial mindset in the creation of solutions and translation to market products and services (business outcome/market sensitive)
      • Strong background on innovation and incubation tactics
      • Background in platform economy, data science and insights.  
      • Strong understanding and application experience in any of the following emerging technologies:
        • Digital platforms/ecosystems: Next generation OSS, BSS and Others
        • Platform economy, transaction and innovation platform business models
        • Multi-cloud/Hyperscalers
        • Blockchain
        • Automated Intelligence and Machine Learning
        • Data and Visual Insights
        • Micro-Services/API as a service 
        • Others: 5G, Secure Access Service Edge, Mobile Edge Computing, SD-WAN, cybersecurity and NFV and IoT
      • Proven leadership in business development for horizontal and vertical market needs.

item.title: Design Specialist II - Geospatial Analytics
item.description:
Description

Join our team

 

The RAN planning and GIS team are a group of highly motivated engineers and business analysts who have a passion for developing and instigating wireless strategy across multiple engineering, implementation and business units. The team is responsible for aligning budgets, organizing work flow and clearing roadblocks amongst numerous partners to ensure the successful planning and rollout of wireless build programs, nationally. Overseeing a broad range of investment drivers, the team leverages big data analytics and geospatial analysis to refine business cases to bring forward new wireless build program investments across Canada.

This is an opportunity to join a highly technical, dynamic team during a transformational journey. With the increasing complexity of radio systems and the advent of 5G wireless technology you will have the opportunity not only to influence the introduction of new technologies and leverage your expertise of modern engineering best practices, including automation and machine learning, but also build a wireless network that delivers continued award-winning customer experiences.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As a Design Specialist with an area of focus on geospatial analytics, you will contribute by developing and implementing key tools and databases in the cloud environment for business intelligence equipping the team to drive and support the future of our network build in this evolving 5G environment. You will be in the forefront of not only driving efficiency but the potential for innovation is endless.

 

Here\'s how


•    Spearhead continued improvements of tools and processes and fuel innovation by leveraging automation and data science techniques
•    Database administration and design
•    Support ETL & big data processes
•    Software development
•    Utilizing Agile methodologies
•    Working with API integrations

Qualifications

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

•    Experience with GIS Spatial data or mapping software
•    Experience with coding/scripting language like Python
•    Experience working in cloud environment like GCP, AWS, CI/CD GitOps
•    Experience with database management.
•    MSSQL, MYSQL, Postgres, Oracle, Big Data, Big Query, Spatial SQL
•    Experience with web development, HTML, Javascript (React)
•    Ability to effectively configure, process and analyze data
•    Detail oriented and analytical thinker
•    Committed to continuous learning and innovation
•    With a Bachelor of Computer Science and/or equivalent related degree

 

Great-to-haves

 

•    Has some knowledge in 3GPP (5G/LTE/UMTS/HSPA) radio access network design, optimization and capacity engineering
•    Familiarity with SPLUNK, Tableau, Alteryx, BluePrism, QGIS
•    Proficiency in Google Workspace

item.title: Product Manager
item.description:
Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies.

 

Join our team 

 

This is an exciting opportunity to take a leading role in transforming TELUS TV as the best customer experience and entertainment service in Canada. As Product Manager, Customer Journey Automation, you will be responsible for helping TELUS drive our ability to provide automated data driven, relevant, timely targeting and messaging to our customers in order to improve their experience and engagement with our TV product. You will collaborate cross-functionally with our marketing teams, technical teams and partner vendors in an agile manner as well as lead and coordinate various teams across the organization to launch products and services to market. 

You will be joining the Video Services Team in the Entertainment & Education Services group as part of Home Solutions Products & Services. This team bridges the business and technical worlds as we design, build and enable capabilities that provide great experiences for customers while achieving the best business outcomes for TELUS. We strive to be a leader in the market for innovation, clear and simple user experience, and content discovery. 

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together 

 

Product Management is about owning the product life cycle, end to end. Applying customer insights and data-driven approaches, you will develop the product backlog and roadmap, gather requirements and then design, build, test and launch features that will be used to improve the customer experience. You will continue to monitor and assess post-launch to make ongoing iterations so that we are developing products and services that truly resonate with users. You will work cross functionally to drive out use cases to improve the customer experience and you will enable others to leverage your product features in order to improve the customer experience. As Product Manager, you will bring together cross-functional teams with your vision, inspiration and organization, and offer thought leadership in strategic planning, assessments and overcoming of obstacles together. 

 

Here\'s how 

 

  • Develop strategic product roadmaps and solid business case justification for new products and enhancements based on user research, data and industry trends
  • Challenge the status quo and experiment with new approaches, tools, and techniques to improve our business’ bottom-line
  • Demonstrate tenacity and resilience that enables you to organize and spearhead initiatives, overcome challenges, and create solutions
  • Perform analysis on customer data and work cross functionally in order to understand and quantify opportunities
  • Manage the delivery of your roadmap 

 

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle 

 

  • Fluency in discussing and understanding technical concepts, scope/schedule tradeoffs, functional requirements and user experience design by collaborating with technical team members
  • The ability to lead, collaborate, support and influence cross functional teams
  • Ability to cultivate strong working relationships with a large extended project team and influence those around you
  • A passion for technology, entertainment and the digital home in general with inquisitiveness and curiosity to learn more
  • A fast learner who has a passion for exploring innovative ideas, and can drive changes through process improvements
  • Post-secondary education in Commerce/Business, Science, Engineering or Technology
  • Experience in any combination of product management, software development, data science and technical project management
  • A passion for data and machine learning 

 

Great-to-haves 

 

  • PMP, agile, lean certifications or relevant experience
  • Big data certifications or experience
  • Experience with customer journey analytics and toolsets, such as Adobe or Google analytics

item.title: Senior Consultant - Community Platforms & Sustainability (Emerging Technology)
item.description:
Join our Team 

 

Interested in inventing the future?


 
You’re part of a team that will shape the evolution of communication, technology and value add services and help our clients stay connected to the people and things that matter to them most. The Sr. Consultant, Community Platforms & Sustainability focused on Emerging Technology is responsible for supporting the innovation, incubation and solution development of key next wave technologies that we need to position to the market. This is required to ensure protection, growth and transformation of our B2B customer base and allow entry to new markets.  This role will work in a matrix team – in collaboration with the CTO and other Business Units to maximize and evolve corporate investments and the TBS Emerging Technology Product team team to utilize the strength of dynamic partner and market segment partnerships to deliver the outcomes.

 

At TELUS, we are looking for people that like solving big problems in a team based organizational structure. We believe that our shared success is as much about what you bring to the table everyday as it is about your skills and qualifications. Smart, motivated people that work well in teams can move mountains!

 

TELUS is a great place to work. You can see it in our team members. The diversity of the TELUS team and their unique contributions set us apart from the competition. Our success is based as much on our future friendly team as the innovative internet, voice, data and wireless products and solutions we offer to consumer and the business markets.

 

Our team members include people like you - enthusiastic, innovative, passionate and energetic. We believe that you’ll find our high-performance culture personally fulfilling, professionally challenging and financially rewarding. 


Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together 

 

As the Senior Consultant for Emerging Technology PLT focused on Community Platforms & Sustainability with a focus on commercialization you will provide technical and services development expertise to support outcome development for the B2B organization - utilizing new technologies either in its standalone derivative or in combination to evolving digital solutions. The core emphasis for this role is to build a community platform (in a marketplace or business platform ecosystem configuration) to drive new lines of revenue, new ways of transacting with the small  business, medium-sized and enterprise segments. There is also a key need for expertise in using sustainability-focused capabilities and value prop to drive differentiation in the market that can start with B2B and can extend to B2C.  You will also work with our CTO, sales, internal stakeholders to develop business opportunities for the company. 

You\'re the ideal candidate with:

  • Strong background and expertise in Community Platform development (multi-network development, differentiation, and co-innovation) - planning and engineering in end to end, or disruptive supply and value chains. 
  • Strong background in marketplace platforms, business platforms (transactional and innovation platforms).
  • Strong consulting background on strategy, business and services development on Sustainability Solutions (strong entrepreneurial, commercialization background – focus is market outcomes development)
  • Strong Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) background: Strategy, Planning and Implementation
  • Strong Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) background: Strategy, Planning and Implementation
  • Strong background on sustainability solutions market incubation, innovation and commercialization.
  • Strong background in circular economy monetization and commercialization.
  • Strong consulting, solution development competencies in various technologies, services and industries. Emphasis on 3rd wave and Industry 4.0 solutions. 
  • Proven experience in business and enterprise architecture and design
  • Proven entrepreneurial mindset in the creation of solutions and translation to market products and services (business outcome/market sensitive)
  • Strong analytical abilities, financial acumen and strategic thinking
  • Strong pragmatic approach to problem solving driving solutions based on scenarios and time horizon
  • Strong background in systems thinking & design thinking 
  • Strong background on innovation and incubation tactics
  • Strong background in investment management. 
  • Very strong background in platform economy, data science and insights.  
  • Strong understanding and application experience in some if not all of the following emerging technologies:
    • Digital platforms/ecosystems: Next generation OSS, BSS and Others
    • Platform economy, transaction and innovation platform business models
    • Multi-cloud/Hyperscalers
    • Blockchain
    • Automated Intelligence and Machine Learning
    • Data and Visual Insights
    • Micro-Services/API as a service 
    • Others: 5G, Secure Access Service Edge, Mobile Edge Computing, SD-WAN, cybersecurity and NFV and IoT
  • Proven leadership in business development for horizontal and vertical market needs. 
  • Proven leadership in partner enablement and activation. 
  • Proven knowledge and leadership in vertical solution development and monetization.
  • Big picture thinker who can provide end-to-end oversight to typically silo-ed functions, great collaborator and can drive team based results (based on cross portfolio product functions). 
  • Ability to understand corporate business strategies and company’s goals, and apply this understanding to make systems/technology development decisions.
  • Excellent service and solution architecture planning skills. 
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Proven ability to drive negotiated outcomes while maintaining strong stakeholder relationships  
  • Strong writing and presentation skills to articulate ideas that involve interpretation, analysis, assessment and alignment.
  • Passion for excellence, strong work ethic and solutions-oriented


Your enthusiasm for learning and innovation, love of a challenge and leadership capabilities will be keys to your success.

 

    What you\'ll do in this role:

    • Develop solution based on emerging technologies to drive business/market outcome
    • Support innovation stream and incubation tactics to prove monetization and scaling of solutions 
    • Support solution selection through corporate investment maximization or validation through partner ecosystems
    • Support packaging solutions for segments, enable entry position for new/untapped markets 
    • Enable proactive benefits management 
    • Lead and influence high performance and collaboration in TELUS

     

     

    You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle:

    • At least 5+ years ESG, SDG and circular economy solutions development and commercialization.
    • At least 5+ years of technology and services consulting, solution and service development background.
    • At least 5+ years of experience in systems, data architecture applications.
    • At least 3+ years of experience in data science practice 
    • At least 3+ years of systems thinking, design thinking and UX background in solution development  
    • At least 5+ years of  strong frameworks knowledge and execution on pragmatic marketing, product management methodologies and processes
    • At least 5+ years, of financial analysis and business case development experience, strategy development methodologies. 
    • At least 5+ years, of strong background in IT architecture, delivery and operations. 
    • At least 5+ years, of strong IT Service Management practice experience: multi-tech and multi-organizational design competencies. 
    • At least 5+ years, Solid ITIL, TMF, TOGAF and PMP and Agile Product and Project Management background 
    • Have ISSP (Sustainability Excellence Associate or Sustainability Excellence Professional) certification.
    • Strong knowledge of wireless / fixed broadband, Telecom and non-Telecom IT applications, systems, platforms and services
    • Engineering, IT or related technical degree with MBA preferred, or MBA with strong technical background and demonstrated experience/competence working with IP, wireless and related technologies, or 5+ years business background in a technology industry with relevant experience in a product management or development role.


    What we give back to you:

    • Opportunities to excel and show your stuff – work on high value and high visibility projects – this is one of the top priorities within the TELUS Business Solutions team
    • Flexible work styles with the ability to work in and out of the office 
    • Work in an organization that actively supports your personal development with leading edge training and development tools
    • An environment that lets you be your best every day
    • Work in an organization that actively supports you giving back to the community you live in
    • Competitive pay & benefits 
    • A place that embraces our core values: 
      • Spirited team work
      • Courage to innovate
      • Embrace change
      • Initiate opportunity and a Passion for growth

item.title: DevOps Engineer - Cyber Security Data Lake Team
item.description:
Join our team

 

We are looking for a DevOps engineer for our cyber security data lake team.

 

The Argus Security Data lake provides big data analytics and Machine Learning capabilities for our security analysts.  Our data lake is used not only to help our response teams investigate incidents but for building machine learning models that help detect suspicious behaviour in our networks and our clients networks.  Our team collaborates with universities and other organizations in research projects to expand our knowledge and capabilities.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As a Devops engineer we need someone who is both a programmer and a systems admin.  Our team maintains a data lake of system logs that our cybersecurity team uses for investigations.  Our devops engineers are required to maintain the systems in the cluster as well as deploying changes and upgrades.  You will be required to work on call on a rotational basis.  You need to have a troubleshooting mindset that can diagnose problems as they are happening.  Help us protect the assets of our clients by keeping our platform performing at its best. This role is a work from home position, you will need to have decent home internet access.  We accept candidates from across Canada as long as they can come into a Telus regional office if needed on occasion.

 

Here’s how

 

  • Ability to work from home with a reliable home internet connection
  • Maintain the data analytics platform by facilitating upgrades and troubleshooting
  • Monitor and troubleshoot system and data issues when they happen
  • Work in an on call rotation to provide support outside of business hours
  • Work closely with our data engineers on deploying upgrades to the platform
  • Be part of an agile team and contribute to discussions on a daily basis

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • Post secondary education in information technology
  • Working knowledge of Unix/Linux command line, Computer Networks, systems development
  • Experience with python, bash scripting, Cron jobs, Gitlab and/or Github
  • Experience working in Agile development teams, familiarity with SDLC 
  • Ability to work outside of normal working hours on call
  • Nice to have: GCP certification or experience
  • Nice to have: experience working with Hadoop and Kafka

item.title: Senior Design Specialist - IP/MPLS (Cloud RAN Orchestration and Automation Team)
item.description:
Description

 

Join Our Team
The Cloud RAN (Radio Access Network) Orchestration & Automation team is a newly created, innovative team that will create end-to-end Open RAN orchestration and automation from architecture, design, development and rollout. With the fast evolving Open RAN ecosystem driven by rapid technological, regulatory, and customer demand changes, the level of uncertainty and complexity of this transformation is increasing. Still, the opportunities are greater today than ever before for industry players like TELUS.  We are embracing disruption, reimagining network services capabilities, and driving growth by leveraging keen professionals to help accelerate automation adoption.  

 

You pride yourself on leading digital transformation by introducing Cloud native technology and advanced software to enable automation. You truly believe in the adoption of automation and orchestration, machine learning, artificial intelligence and data analytics to drive intelligent network operation that enables the efficient and creative growth of wireless networks, while reducing costs. Finally, your passion and initiative in translating and applying your learnings in wireless communication networks will propel TELUS’ digital transformation.

 

Here’s how

  • Lead the development of wireless network orchestration and automation architecture, strategy, design, and rollout to minimize human intervention in the life cycle of wireless networks from introduction to operation
  • Work with cloud-native technologies, combining the modern technologies, practices, and products into a cohesive platform to enable network automation operation
  • Through collaboration with multiple teams, you will drive innovation in automation, artificial intelligence, and big data analytics 
  • Create business cases to secure necessary capital for overall Open RAN automation initiative 
  • You will work with other senior architects in order to identify the best way to develop, integrate, and deploy the RAN automation in a commercial network
  • You will estimate scope of work required to implement the necessary architectures in order to support technical leads in the development of unified and reliable delivery plans

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

  • 8 or more years of experiences with LTE, 5G NSA (Non-stand alone) and SA (Standalone) RAN (Radio access network) design and development; familiar with associated 3GPP standards;
  • Experiences with telecommunication operation support system (OSS) development, maintenance or support. 
  • 3 or more years of working experience on IP/MPLS and Kubernetes network, familiar with associated protocols (VxLAN, Calico, CNI, Restful APIs etc.). 
  • Familiar with Telecommunication industry wireless access DevOps workflows of design, plan, deployment, change management and operations. 
  • Knowledgeable in one or more programming / scripting languages (Python, GO, XML, Java, YAML, Shell, JSON etc.)
  • Experience with managed Kubernetes services such as Google’s Kubernetes Engine (GKE), Amazon’s Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS), RedHat OpenShift, WindRiver Cloud platform, Robin.io cloud platform.
  • Experience on managing and developing cloud-native containerized micro services
  • Creative approach to problem solving and an ability to work independently in an environment with high levels of ambiguity
  • Ability to manage key deliverables as part of an extended project team
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to translate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
  • A Bachelor or Master Degree in Electrical/computer engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems

 

Great-to-haves 

  • 5G RAN cell site deployment automation development experiences, including workflow engine, inventory databases
  • Familiar with Open-RAN and ETSI specifications and standards
  • Multi- or Hybrid-cloud architectures
  • Experience with Big Data and Analytics tools such as Kafka, Elastic Search, Kinesis, Hadoop, Big Query, DataFlow, Pub/Sub, Prometheus etc.

item.title: E2E Data Analytics Architect
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team 
The Network architecture and convergence is a newly created, innovative team that is also responsible for cross-domain network architecture development covering cloud orchestration, network slicing, automation and assurance, data analytics and network exposure with holistic architecture alignment;  in addition to wireless/wireline convergence covering access, network, policy, subscriber data, provisioning and charging. With the fast evolving 5G ecosystem driven by rapid technological, regulatory, and customer demand changes, the level of uncertainty and complexity of this transformation is increasing. Still, the opportunities are greater today than ever before for industry players like TELUS. We are embracing disruption, reimagining network services capabilities, and driving growth by leveraging the latest technologies  

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together 
You are a E2E network data analytics architect who prides yourself on leading digital transformation by introducing latest technology  of artificial intelligence and machine learning models. You truly believe in the adoption of IT and cloud orchestration and automation, and data analytics to drive intelligent network operation that enables the efficient and creative growth of wireless and wireline networks, while reducing costs. Finally, your passion and initiative in translating and applying your learnings in wireless and wireline communication networks will propel TELUS’ digital transformation.

 

Here’s how

  • You will lead the cross domain network analytics architecture, strategy, design, and align data analytics with automation, 5G network slicing, cloud, and 5G network 
  • You will develop/design E2E network data analytics framework applied to Radio, core, transport, service and cloud (hyper scaler) domains, to enable truly artificial intelligent network with machine learning capability
  • Through collaboration with multiple teams, you will drive innovation in automation, artificial intelligence, and big data analytics
  • Create business cases to secure necessary capital for overall cross domain network analytics 
  • You will work with other senior architects in order to identify the existing gaps in the network  to get fully automated network with predicative model by Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

  • Architecture and design experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP)/OpenShift Container Platform (OCP)/Amazon Web Services (AWS) and/or Azure products
  • Experience with containerization tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, and/or OpenStack technology and networking (CNI, Calico, Multus, VxLAN, vSwitch etc.)
  • Skilled in Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools, i.e. Spinnaker, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GCP Cloud Build,  Jupyter etc
  • Machine learning open source frame work  (PyTorch, JAX and NumPy,TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, Pandas etc.)
  • 5+ years of relevant IT Architecture experience, advanced technical and analytical skills, and the ability to take responsibility for the overall technical direction of the project
  • Knowledgeable in one or more development/scripting languages and orchestration/API tools  (Java, YAML, Shell, Json, Python, Keras etc.)
  • Advanced knowledge in SQL and Apache Spark
  • Well versed in software and AI development lifecycles, including ML Ops
  • Knowledge of 5G network protocols and experience with network management are pluses
  • Expert knowledge of the software project lifecycle—from concept through design to implementation and test.
  • Proven track record of leading data analytics, 5G SA and automation projects
  • Creative approach to problem solving and an ability to work independently in an environment with high levels of ambiguity
  • Ability to manage key deliverables as part of an extended project team
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to translate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
  • A Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field, Master’s preferred

 

Great-to-haves

  • 5+ years of telecommunications experience
  • Multi- or Hybrid-cloud architectures
  • Experience with Big Data & Analytics tools such as Kafka, Kinesis, Hadoop, Big Query, DataFlow, Pub/Sub, etc

item.title: Senior Design Specialist - Cloud RAN Orchestration and Automation
item.description:
Bring forth your 5G RAN and automation expertise to enhance TELUS’ award winning wireless network. 

 

Join Our Team

 

The Cloud RAN (Radio Access Network) Orchestration & Automation team is a newly created, innovative team that will create end-to-end Open RAN orchestration and automation from architecture, design, development and rollout. With the fast evolving Open RAN ecosystem driven by rapid technological, regulatory, and customer demand changes, the level of uncertainty and complexity of this transformation is increasing. Still, the opportunities are greater today than ever before for industry players like TELUS.  We are embracing disruption, reimagining network services capabilities, and driving growth by leveraging keen professionals to help accelerate automation adoption.  
 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together 

 

You are a Senior Design Specialist who prides yourself on leading digital transformation by introducing Cloud native technology and advanced software to enable automation. You truly believe in the adoption of automation and orchestration, machine learning, artificial intelligence and data analytics to drive intelligent network operation that enables the efficient and creative growth of wireless networks, while reducing costs. Finally, your passion and initiative in translating and applying your learnings in wireless communication networks will propel TELUS’ digital transformation.

 

Here’s how

 

  • You will lead the development of wireless network orchestration and automation architecture, strategy, design, and rollout to minimize human intervention in the life cycle of wireless networks from introduction to operation
  • Work with cloud-native technologies, combining the modern technologies, practices, and products into a cohesive platform to enable network automation operation
  • Through collaboration with multiple teams, you will drive innovation in automation, artificial intelligence, and big data analytics 
  • Create business cases to secure necessary capital for overall Open RAN automation initiative 
  • You will work with other senior architects in order to identify the best way to develop, integrate, and deploy the RAN automation in a commercial network
  • You will estimate scope of work required to implement the necessary architectures in order to support technical leads in the development of unified and reliable delivery plans

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • 8 or more years of experiences with LTE, 5G NSA (Non-stand alone) and SA (Standalone) RAN (Radio access network) design and development; familiar with associated 3GPP standards;
  • 3 or more years of experiences with telecommunication operation support system (OSS) development, maintenance or support. Familiar with telecommunication network protocols such as RESTful, NETCONF, TCP/IP, UDP, etc.
  • 2 or more years of working experience on 5G wireless air interfaces technologies, including FDD/TDD Massive MIMO, CA (Carrier aggregation) and CoMP etc.
  • Familiar with Telecommunication industry wireless access DevOps workflows of design, plan, deployment, change management and operations. 
  • Knowledgeable in one or more programming / scripting languages (Python, GO, XML, Java, YAML, Shell, JSON etc.)
  • Experience with managed Kubernetes services such as Google’s Kubernetes Engine (GKE), Amazon’s Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS), RedHat OpenShift, WindRiver Cloud platform, Robin.io cloud platform.
  • Experience on managing and developing cloud-native containerized micro services
  • Creative approach to problem solving and an ability to work independently in an environment with high levels of ambiguity
  • Ability to manage key deliverables as part of an extended project team
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to translate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
  • Proactive, can lead cross-team initiatives
  • A Bachelor or Master Degree in Electrical/computer engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems

 

Great-to-haves 

 

  • 5G RAN cell site deployment automation development experiences, including workflow engine, inventory databases
  • Familiar with Open-RAN and ETSI specifications and standards
  • Multi- or Hybrid-cloud architectures

item.title: Engineer II - Ran Development
item.description:
Description

Position Overview:
 
Working with TELUS Technology Strategy teammates, stakeholders, and vendors, the successful candidate will be responsible for LTE and 5G RAN technology design and development, solution optimization, and provide technical support for Broadband Network P&E teams inside TELUS. The candidate must possess solid knowledge of LTE & 5G products, 3GPP specs, RF design and optimization and is willing to take challenges to deal with customer service impacting issues.
 
Responsibilities:
 
The successful candidate will join the Wireless Access Architecture Team within Technology Strategy by taking the following responsibilities: 
 
•    Responsible for LTE and 5G RAN network hardware, software and feature new technology introduction
•    Proactively Communicate/clarify TELUS requirements to vendors and evaluates responses
•    Translate LTE/5G technical aspects into business impact and vice versa, plus E2E integration requirement  
•    Propose solutions and features optimization engineering guidelines, provide support for field teams
•    Plan the execution of TELUS strategy and get involved in the execution 
•    Validate vendor compliance to industry/TELUS standards and the functional and performance requirements by conducting lab proof of concept and interoperability testing with other systems, etc.
•    Communicate and present cross-team to explain the technical decisions and their outcomes
•    Keep well informed of the latest wireless technology developments relating to the field of practice 

Qualifications

Required Knowledge:


•    Solid knowledge on LTE/5G RF design and optimization (5+ years’ experience), Proficient in RF propagation and modeling, interference and link budget analysis, and network infrastructure (Macro cell, Micro cell, Pico cell,) and protocols (i.e. TCP/IP).
•    Understand future network technology evolution: HeNet (small cell), AI & Machine learning, MEC, 5G Network slicing, and SDN/virtualization, Cloud technology …
•    Familiar with 3GPP spec., including air interface implementation, RRM, MM, and RF compliance.
•    Understand basic knowledge of IP, Video streaming, Multicast, and other networking protocols,
•    Hands-on experience with the network/performance testing tools such as IXIA, SmartBits, Chariot, QXDM, Agilent drive testing tool, XCAL, TEMS, and Actix tool IP based application knowledge and exposure to network security would also be assets 
•    5 or more years performing lab testing evaluations including and not limited to proof of concept. Experience in writing test plan for different scenarios, collecting requirements from users
•    Ability to provide on demand, specialized technical advice for the technical solution of a number of wide ranging problems and to interact with others including on a proactive customer focused basis
•    Familiar with wireless network trouble shooting procedure and performance enhancement process with knowledge related 


Required Skills and Abilities:


•    Excellent English oral and written communication skills
•    Proactive, can lead cross-team initiatives 
•    Strong team and collaborative skills, ability to lead/perform in a team environment
•    High level of personal energy and willingness to take the initiative in planning and organizing daily work
•    Sets high personal standards of performance and is capable of adapting to changes in priorities, work assignments and schedules in a dynamic environment
•    Good judgment in discerning between priority and non-priority issues
•    Sets and achieves challenging work goals for self (i.e. professionalism, self-motivated, ambitious, reliable, accurate, courteous)
•    Strong desire to acquire and apply new skills in a constantly evolving highly technical environment
•    Demonstrates strong sense of urgency and drives issues to closure
•    Proficient in the use and application of PC-based applications (i.e. MS Office suite: Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Visio)


 
Required Professional Designation/Certification:


•    Bachelor or Master Degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering or an equivalent 
 
Required Experience:

 

5+ years’ experience in wireless communication industry

item.title: Senior Security Consultant - Secure by Design
item.description:
Description

 Join our team

 We live in a fast-paced cyber-world where protecting our information has become paramount. At TELUS Security, we strive to always be steps ahead, tackling the toughest security challenges head-on with top talent and cutting edge technology.
The Secure by Design (SbD) team enables TELUS, at an early stage of its project lifecycle, to build secure solutions by following a secure by design principled approach. We carry out thorough security assessments, identify risks and provide expert consulting by way of security control recommendations to technology and business partners. 
 
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together  

As a Senior Security Consultant you will leverage your subject matter expertise in the field of cyber security to assess network/system/application design and implementation and offer consultation to enhance security postures. You will partner with IT architects, network engineers, and software developers across Mobility, Cloud, and IoT teams making a difference in protecting the availability, integrity, and confidentiality of TELUS services & information. In this specific role your key areas of focus would be security assessments for both TELUS & TELUS Health.
 

Here\'s How

Perform security threat and risk analysis, network, system and application-level security reviews on a wide variety of TELUS services, acquisitions and even product offerings which include Internet of Things ( IoT), Robotic Process Automations (RPAs) and Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning ( AI and ML) and Cloud. Assess network, system and application designs and implementations with a security lens to discover subtle security issues for unexpected threat scenarios including conducting all of these for TELUS Health systems too. Get the chance to collaborate with and liaise with many stakeholders, from the Privacy team to which you will provide data Subject Matter Expert (SME) recommendations, to project teams, solutions architects and technologists during their design phases to ensure Security is top of mind and up to industry standards.Apply security standards and best practices to recommend solutions for advanced information and network security requirements and plan, research & design information security into networks and systems with hands-on application of technical methods and techniques and policies and procedures.

Design and implement risk driven information and network security solutions and evaluate and design security and controls for new technologies to address such areas as infrastructure, security administration, user identification and authentication, data security, network and host intrusion prevention, detection and monitoring. Assist with and participate in the development of information, system and network protection policies, procedures, strategies and architectures to define and support TELUS’ information and network security programs while educating and coaching peer groups of architects and engineers on how to better design security into their various projects
 

Qualifications

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

  • 5+ years cybersecurity experience in Health, Software, Telecom or IT industries
  • Distinguished for your intimate knowledge of information/network security technology, audit and control measures, monitoring/investigation methodologies and privacy/regulatory/criminal legislation
  • Recognized for your advanced knowledge of application security, systems security and network security in emerging technologies
  • Expert in understanding and application of major security standards, guidance, and frameworks based on NIST CSF, HIPAA, ISO/IEC 27000, OWASP, PCI, CIS, etc. to the realities of business and information security
  • Valued for your leadership skills:
  • Ability to influence decisions of peers/teams with technical authority and trust based relationships
  • Ability to technically direct/lead teams
  • Ability to build consensus in team environments and manage conflict while striving for shared goals and objectives
  • Ability to mentor junior team mgembers and aid in their development
  • Ability to make decisions with imperfect information
  • Ability to admit mistakes and bring correction and course change in a timely manner
  • Reasonably skilled in project management and system deployment methodologies
  • Commended for your excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • With a university degree preferably in a technology related field
  • Regarded for one or more security or other applicable certifications such as CISSP; CISA; CISM; CRISC; ISO27000, ITIL
  • The candidate should have or be willing to undergo a Secret II clearance, due to the nature of their employment

Great to haves

  • 2+ years of operational, system administration, or infrastructure build and deployment in a security-focused environment, especially in environments pertaining to processing and storage of Health information (ePHI)
  • Knowledge of Health industry and associated network technologies (5-10 years)
  • Background in IT audit and technical project management (with a strong security component) will also be considered

item.title: Finance Data & Analytics Lead
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

As a key member of the Finance Data & Analytics team, the role of Finance Data and Analytics Lead is instrumental in enhancing Data & Analytics capabilities by championing industry best practices and delivering high quality reports and training to enhance business decision making. They help translate complex solutions to digestible business-centric outcomes and will do so by building interactive data visualizations using Power BI, Anaplan / Oracle and other sophisticated data modelling applications.

They will work with business-unit leaders to identify and prioritize problems that analytics is suited to solve and help identify the data (internal or external) needed to produce the most useful insights. In addition to being responsible for end to end solutions that business users can execute on, they also work towards driving adoption among business users. The individual will support and collaborate with Finance and Investment Professionals, Data Engineers, Data Scientists and engage in technical support, research and knowledge sharing through the implementation lifecycle of projects and solutions. The ideal candidate is one that is open to constantly learning new tools and Technologies as well as delivering consumption ready Analytics Solutions that solve Business problems.

Position Scope:

  • Engage Finance and Business Teams on Data Process Discovery

  • Lead the Design, Build, Document and Operational Maintenance of Finance Analytics Assets including Dashboards, Workflows, Data pipelines and Finance Data Mart.

  • Develop Finance Analytics solutions encompassing aspects of automation and value-added Analytics Reporting

  • Engage & collaborate with Finance Operations Teams to execute on Finance Platform Roadmap.

  • Engage & collaborate with Enterprise Data & Analytics to deliver optimal effective solutions (Data Engineering, Data Governance and Enterprise AI & Automation COE)

  • Leading contributor to Finance group Data & Analytics literacy of Program.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

  • Provide Thought leadership to Senior Leadership on use cases and contribute to Finance Analytics Roadmap.

  • Lead Finance Analytics community of Practice within Finance peer groups and prototype Analytics use case.

  • Lead Analytics projects end-to-end from Requirements gathering to Development.

  • Develop Data pipelines & manage Finance Data Mart in sync with Enterprise Data Engineering / Governance Teams.

  • Developing and monitoring Dataflows to gather, transform and democratize structured and unstructured data assets

  • Ensure Data Governance best practices are applied and adhered to for Finance.

  • Managing change and communicating impacts to stakeholders and fellow team member

  • Leading multiple projects simultaneously and ensuring on-time delivery

  • Support Financial Systems on Platform Transformation initiatives pertaining to Data & Analytics.

  • Collaborating with data architects, engineers, and data scientists to carve out solutions that can support ongoing and future analytical capabilities

To succeed in this role, you have:

  • Bachelor’s / Masters degree in information systems, Business Analytics, Data Science, Business, Accounting, Finance, or related discipline with five (5) + years of experience.

  • Expert proficiency in SQL (Experience with SQL Server Management Studio – Role requires building Data Pipelines) , Python proficiency is an asset.

  • A breadth of technical experience and knowledge in the MSFT data and analytics ecosystem, with Subject Matter Expertise in Power BI (DAX), Azure Data Factory / Synapse

  • Experience with iPaaS tools is preferred but not required.

  • Experience with Oracle/SAP ERP’s with understanding of Accounting life cycle is beneficial.

  • Interest in Machine Learning / Data Science and its practical applications as it pertains to Finance.

  • Excellent Data Visualization skills and experience of developing Dashboards using Power BI for Operational Analytics as well as Executive Reporting.

  • Build cohesive relationships with Business and Technical Experts across Enterprise.

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. 

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives. 

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

item.title: Product Designer, Analytics & Data Science
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers.

The Advanced Analytics team at Oxford Properties Group is looking for a brilliant Product Designer to bring our Analytics and Data Science products to life and provide an outstanding user experience to internal and external audiences.

As a best-in-class real estate organization, Oxford has an ambitious plan to leverage analytics capabilities across the real estate value chain including acquisition, development, operations, and disposition at a global scale.

The Advanced Analytics team works on a wide range of business problems aligned to Oxford’s strategic priorities, from using alternative data to fine-tune investment decisions to crunching operational and smart building data to streamline how we manage our assets and unlock new revenue streams.

Commercial Real Estate is a $200 Trillion industry - larger than the public equities and bond market combined - and yet is only just being disrupted by data and technology. This opens a fantastic opportunity for you to develop thought leadership and champion design practices, transforming how the real estate industry unlocks value from data.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

  • Being part of a highly skilled cross-functional analytics team, reporting to the Senior Director of Advanced Analytics
  • Working closely with our data scientists and data engineers to shape analytics and machine learning (ML) products allowing Oxford to make faster, better data-driven decisions
  • Understanding our business stakeholders across various Oxford teams by running interviews and workshops to gather user feedback on what they care about and what stands in their way
  • Distilling large amounts of insights and complex interactions with data science algorithms into an intuitive, seamless, and delightful user experience for consumers of analytics
  • Building dashboards or web app prototypes to test with users, gathering feedback on what works and where they struggle
  • Improving the user experience in finding the answer to key business questions via analytics
  • Developing a beautiful and consistent look-and-feel for our analytics products
  • Encouraging design thinking amongst our data scientists and data engineers

To succeed in this role, you have:

  • 3-5 years’ experience of working as a Product Designer or equivalent product design portfolio
  • A proven track record of creating brilliant and intuitive products (designing interfaces for data and analytics-driven products a strong plus)
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to influence both technical and non-data fluent business partners
  • Experience running user research, user testing, and A/B testing
  • Experience creating user personas, user flows, and seamless customer journeys
  • Experience organizing and running design workshops
  • A test and learn approach to design, iterating clickable prototypes quickly based on internal and external feedback
  • Solid working knowledge of design tools (such as Figma or Sketch)

You will stand out if you have:

  • Excellent data visualization skills and working knowledge of data visualization and reporting tools (such as PowerBI or Tableau)
  • A proven ability to distil large volumes of data points, insights, charts, maps, forecasts, and recommendations into an intuitive experience for a non-data fluent audience
  • A high-level understanding or personal passion for data insights, analytics, and data science
  • Experience of working with data teams to design web apps to interface with ML models
  • Experience of designing

Our story:

Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$70 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences and hotels; it spans more than 150 million square feet in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 100 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario\'s municipal employees.

For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

item.title: Senior BI & Data Analyst
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

Why Join Us?


The Senior BI & Data Analyst, Global Investments Technology (GIT) will join a team that leads the delivery of the products and platforms that enable OMERS Global Investments (GI) to analyze opportunities, action investment decisions and optimize the OMERS investment portfolio. GIT works across investment teams including Capital Markets, Infrastructure, Private Equity, Growth Equity and Ventures, and in close collaboration with Finance, Risk & Compliance teams.

As a key member of the Global Investments Technology team, the Senior Data Analyst is instrumental in enhancing data & analytics capabilities by championing industry best practices and delivering high quality datasets, reports, and training to enhance business decision making.

The Senior BI & Data Analyst will develop Power BI datasets and reports to support OMERS investment entities, maintain a healthy business relationship to assist in meeting business demands and deliver training workshops to promote a data culture. The Senior BI & Data Analyst will also support and collaborate with data engineers, data scientists and investment professionals and engage in technical support, research and knowledge sharing through the implementation as part of 1 or more product team(s).

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

Technical

  • Organizing workshops with partners to gather requirements and develop low/high fidelity wireframes
  • Developing and monitoring Power BI Premium Dataflows to gather, transform and democratize structured and unstructured data assets
  • Developing Power BI datasets by applying best-practice semantic modeling techniques
  • Building visually stunning reports that clearly communicate an effective story
  • Leading solution build, delivery, support and troubleshooting
  • Provisioning and managing resources of Premium Capacity
  • Managing the Power BI / Power Platform infrastructure
  • Usage Monitoring and Auditing

Organizational

  • Operating in an Agile development environment
  • Communicating effectively with analysts and various partners across multiple teams and with various other partners such as product managers, data engineers and members of senior management
  • Managing change and communicating impacts to partners and fellow team members
  • Facilitating collaboration and sharing through best practices of delivering and sharing content
  • Identifying, defining and implementing opportunities for improving existing processes
  • Exhibiting the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and ensuring timely delivery
  • Leading the Power BI Community of Interest to review the latest features and updates
  • Collaborating with other teams and establishing Power Platform Governance and Support

To succeed in this role, you have:

Professional

  • Experience. 5+ years solving complex technical projects as a full-stack (M & DAX) Power BI developer
  • A Bachelor’s Degree in a scientific or engineering field of study or equivalent work experience
  • Microsoft certification – Data Analyst Associate
  • Industry Knowledge of best practices learned from MVP & Product Team articles and Investments/Finance.
  • Training. Excited to support new Power BI users by running various internal community initiatives such as presentations, hands-on workshops, or troubleshooting end-user obstacles.
  • Demonstrated success building deep technical relationships and aligning expectations across various partners.
  • Problem-Solving. The ability to trace data lineage and resolve technical issues with minimal direction.
  • Teamwork. Motivated and keen to work in a collaborative environment with a focus on team success.

Technical

  • A depth of Power BI experience wrangling complex data using M functions and developing sophisticated semantic logic using DAX expressions
  • Connect/Transform. Knows what “M” is, how to merge, append, and perform more advanced UI transforms
  • Model. Basic knowledge of dimension / fact tables and can identify them in a dimensional model. Comfortable with simple DAX, knows the CALCULATE function well and can explain how it works.
  • Visualization.  Recommends appropriate visualizations to answer business questions and references examples of published materials that explain how to choose a visual. Proficient at all ways to manipulate look & feel.
  • Admin/Architecture. Has experience configuring Administrative features in the tenant. Knows how to install and manage a gateway. Basic levels of understanding of licensing.
  • Embed/Custom Visuals. Understand that Power BI can be embedded internally and knows how to add and share in Teams.
  • Breadth of technical experience and knowledge in the MSFT data and analytics ecosystem, with Subject Matter Expertise in two or more of the following items:
    • Power BI Service administration
    • Power BI Desktop
    • Tabular Editor and DAX Studio
    • Azure Synapse Analytics
    • Azure Data Factory
    • Azure Machine Learning
    • Azure Databricks

item.title: Senior Data Engineer, Global Investments Technology
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Title:                      Senior Data Engineer, Global Investments Technology

Reporting to:     Associate Director, Data & Analytics

About OMERS:

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor? If so, we would love to tell you our story.

At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe. Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

Why Join Us?

The Senior Data Engineer, Global Investments Technology (GIT) will join a team that leads the delivery of the products and platforms that enable OMERS Global Investments (GI) to analyze opportunities, action investment decisions and optimize the OMERS investment portfolio. GIT works across investment teams including Capital Markets, Infrastructure, Private Equity, Growth Equity and Ventures, and in close collaboration with Finance, Risk & Compliance teams.

As a key member of the Global Investments Technology team, the Senior Data Engineer is instrumental in improving data & analytics capabilities by championing industry best practices and delivering data as a product to support investment decision making.

The Senior Data Engineer will operationalize and maintain data pipelines deployed to the OMERS investment entities and cultivate a business relationship that assists in meeting business demands. The individual must also support and collaborate with data analysts, data scientists and investment professionals and engage in technical support, research and integration as part of 1 or more product team(s).

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

Technical

  • Translating requirements into solutions
  • Defining and executing technical test plans, performing unit, performance and integration tests and automating regression tests
  • Deploying ETL/ELT pipelines to achieve a high level of reliability, scalability and security
  • Sourcing, transforming and delivering structured and unstructured assets for analytical use
  • Optimizing performance of ETL pipelines and data sources
  • Participating in solution build, delivery, support and troubleshooting
  • Provisioning and managing Azure resources, including security and cost
  • Monitoring pipelines. Improving reliability. Automating audit

Organizational

  • Operating in an Agile development environment
  • Communicating effectively with other engineers and various other partners such as product managers, data & business analysts, IT infrastructure specialists, security specialists, enterprise architects and members of senior management
  • Leading change and communicating impacts to partners and fellow team members
  • Identifying, defining and implementing opportunities for improving existing processes
  • Exhibiting the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and ensuring timely delivery
  • Participating in establishing sound data management practices for the team and the organization
  • helping shape and scale the future of our development and production infrastructure

Qualifications:

Professional

  • Experience. 5+ years solving sophisticated technical data projects using the Microsoft Azure data stack or equivalent work experience. Financial industry application is preferred.
  • A Bachelor’s Degree in a scientific or engineering field of study or equivalent work experience
  • Microsoft Data engineer associate level certificate will be considered as an asset
  • Industry Knowledge of best practices. Previous experience in developing and deploying operational procedures, tuning guides and best practices documentation
  • Relationship Building. Consistent track record of building deep technical relationships. Experience in aligning expectations across various partners
  • Problem-Solving. The ability to trace data lineage / workflows and resolve technical issues with minimal direction
  • Teamwork. Motivated and keen to work in a collaborative environment with a focus on team success

Technical

  • Enterprise-scale technical experience with cloud and hybrid infrastructures, architecture designs, and technology management
  • Experience with data architecture, modeling, data warehousing
  • Breadth of technical experience and knowledge across the Azure Data Platform, with depth / Subject Matter Expertise in two or more of the following Data Platform resources:
    • Azure Data Factory
    • Azure Databricks, experience with Scala/Python/Spark
    • Azure Functions using C#, PowerShell or Python
    • Azure SQL Database or PostgreSQL
    • Azure Synapse Analytics
    • Azure Cosmos DB
    • Azure App Services
    • Azure Logic Apps
  • Proven experience automating CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps or equivalent work experience
  • Experience with the Microsoft Power Platform is preferred
  • Experience with SQL Server Data Tools
  • Experience developing star schema reporting pipelines using Kimball or Data Vault v2.0 methodologies

Our story
Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging.
