item.title: Senior Enterprise Data Architect
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers.

Reporting into the Director of Enterprise Architecture, the Senior Enterprise Data Architect strengthens the impact of, and provides recommendations on, business information that will need to be available and shared consistently across the organization through the identification, definition and analysis of how information assets aid strategies and business outcomes. The Senior Enterprise Data Architect is responsible for data management and governance, solution architecture for data projects, implementation of risk and controls for all initiatives.

You will be a key member of an engaged, high-reaching team—part of a world-class, winning culture that prioritizes people development and focuses on long-term growth. We take great pride in leading the industry by earning respect through every interaction, every day. We go above and beyond to protect and grow relationships by anticipating needs, being honest and considerate and valuing customers and colleagues as genuine partners.

Commercial Real Estate is a $200 Trillion industry that is larger than the public equities and bond market combined, and yet is only just being disrupted by technology.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

Influence information strategy: By partnering with business unit leadership, and through the rationalization of the information value chain, the information architect define, lead and communicate information and data management strategies and plans as well strategic recommendations to maximize the value of information assets via their creation, access and use.

Maximize value derived from data and analytics: Foster value creation using the organization\'s data assets, as well as the external data ecosystem. This includes aiding value creation through data exploitation, envisioning data-enabled strategies, as well as enabling all forms of business outcomes through analytics, data and analytics governance, and enterprise information policy.

Enhance decision making: Use tools such as business information models to provide the organization with a future-state view of the information landscape that is unencumbered by the specific data implementation details imposed by proprietary solutions or technologies. Assist decision design.

Conduct business information modeling: Create and manage business information models in all their forms, including conceptual models, relational database designs, message models and others.

Manage risk: Aid the definition of data classifications and data zoning to allow information assets to be immediately identified and proactively managed as more information becomes federated in a digital economy.

Secure data and analytic assets: Aid in the analysis of data and analytics security requirements and solutions ensuring compliance with controls and standards across all data initiatives.  

Improve EIM performance: Aid efforts to improve business performance through enterprise information solutions and capabilities, such as master data management (MDM), metadata management, analytics, content management, data integration, and related information management or information infrastructure components.

To succeed in this role, you have:

Education and Training

This role requires a bachelor\'s degree in computer science, information systems or a related study (or equivalent project-related experience).

Experience

  • A minimum of ten years of experience in IT, with at least seven years in information system design.
  • In-depth experience of designing and implementing information solutions.
  • Hands-on experience with implementing data management programs is preferred.
  • Five to seven years\' experience in enterprise data architecture is highly desirable.

Required Knowledge and Skills

  • Familiarity with information management practices, system development life cycle management, IT services management, agile and lean methodologies, infrastructure and operations, and EA and ITIL frameworks.
  • Define and build enterprise data management policies, processes, solutions and associated documentation to strengthen data management
  • Develop capability and technology solutions around key data governance areas of data sharing, access management, data quality management, data lineage, metadata management and the data catalog, records management, information risk and controls. Automate data management processes and governance activities related to key governance areas
  • Data modeling and information classification expertise at the enterprise level.
  • Understanding of metamodels, taxonomies and ontologies, as well as of the challenges of applying structured techniques (data modeling) to less-structured sources.
  • Familiarity with data science concepts, as well as MDM, business intelligence, and data warehouse design and implementation techniques.
  • Experience with distributed management and analytics in cloud and hybrid environments. Also an understanding of a variety of data access and analytics approaches (for example, microservices and event-based architectures).
  • Ability to assess rapidly changing technologies and apply them to business needs.
  • Strong communication and persuasion skills, including the ability to create marketing and messaging materials that meet stakeholder needs.

Key Behaviors and Competencies

  • Demonstrate the ability to work well with others and exhibit leadership.
  • Have a track record of remaining unbiased toward specific technologies or vendors.
  • Be an excellent communicator and collaborator, engaging with multiple technical and business stakeholders and leaders.
  • Be able to translate the information architecture contribution to business outcomes into simple briefings for use by various data-and-analytics-related roles.
  • Ability to understand the long-term ("big picture") and short-term perspectives of situations.
  • Ability to quickly comprehend the functions and capabilities of new technologies.
  • Display intellectual curiosity and integrity.

Our story:

Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$70 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences and hotels; it spans more than 150 million square feet in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 100 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario\'s municipal employees.

For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

item.title: Lead Data Governance Specialist
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

The Lead Data Governance Specialist works as part of the Enterprise Data Governance Team to support the implementation of new data governance tools and related processes, with a focus on enterprise data cataloging, metadata management, business workflows and data quality management.

This role will work closely with the Business teams and other Data & Technology partners to ensure data governance standards, policies and best practices are understood and applied consistently across the organization.

Responsibilities:

  • Understand OMERS business functions, activities, and transactions, as well as standard information and data governance best practices to contribute practical solutions for both structured and unstructured data in the development and implementation of the Data Governance Program

  • Design, develop and monitor technology solutions around key data governance focus areas of data catalog, metadata management, data quality management, data lineage business workflows and access management

  • Partner with Enterprise Data Governance Managers and Data Stewards to define and instrument metadata capture and storage for the CDE’s, evolve our enterprise business glossary, and facilitate the linkage between business definitions and the underlying technical metadata

  • Manage the processes around metadata repositories (data dictionary, business glossary) and data classification process (identification of sensitive data)

  • Perform data profiling, data quality analysis and the development of data quality rules to support monitoring and remediation activities

  • Refine and implement the enterprise metadata management framework, inclusive of business, operational and technical metadata

  • Provide ongoing access, maintenance, usage, and technical support for our Data Governance Tool inventory including Collibra, Azure Purview

  • Contribute to the development of reporting requirements to monitor data compliance as well as KPIs and metrics to gauge the health and maturity of data governance program

  • Collaborate with business and D&T partners to find opportunities to improve data accuracy and ensure that data owners are accountable for remediation

  • Contribute to the development of appropriate materials, conducting training sessions and be the change advocates to drive data governance best practices

  • Provide inputs on the design and development of data models for data warehousing and cataloging projects

  • Work closely with Data & Technology team during the development of new information and data governance related applications, including requirements validation and testing

  • Primary point of contact for business partners to resolve data security & access issues

 

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering, math or a field related to information, data management, analytics or financial services.

  • 3 - 5 years of technical experience in implementing data governance, data analytics or data quality tools

  • Knowledge and expertise in data governance technology, business process modeling, metadata, data lineage, data classification, data quality and enterprise implementation of data governance tools and solutions

  • Experience in defining and building enterprise data management policies, processes, solutions, and associated documentation to strengthen data management

  • Experience with SQL, database applications MS SQL/ Oracle, and visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau

  • Understanding of Cloud, Big Data technologies, architectural concepts - data lake, data warehouse, relational databases, data ingestion, ETL etc.

  • Hand’s on experience with tools such as Ataccama, Collibra, Informatica EIC/ BDM/BDQ, IBM IGC/ IA/ DQS, Microsoft Purview or similar

  • Knowledge and understanding of data regulations, privacy, ethical use, data sharing, critical data indicators, access management and data masking techniques

  • Excellent verbal and written communication to effectively articulate and communicate with both business and technical development teams

  • A team player with a good understanding of the Agile methodology and Change management

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. 

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives. 

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

item.description:

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. The Lead Business Analyst will work alongside information management and data governance specialists on their team and partner with data and analytics specialists within businesses and corporate functions to design, develop, implement and scale advanced solutions following best practices to drive measurable business outcomes.

Reporting to the Manager, Enterprise Data Governance, you will work closely with our business and technology teams to support the implementation of the OMERS Enterprise Information and Data Governance, stewardship and continuous improvement by focusing primarily on the implementation of Collibra, Informatica and additional tools & processes.

  • Driving a culture of innovation by supporting training and enablement activities such as lunch and learns, hackathons, etc.

  • 5+ years of experience in business analysis, working specifically on data governance projects

  • Minimum three (3) years’ hands-on experience with a data quality tool such as Informatica or similar tools
  • Solid grasp of data quality, metadata management, and data governance standards and best practices
  • Experience in using external/alternative data, data modeling, data architecture, data engineering, insight generation, data visualization, feature engineering and AI systems development & optimization is preferred
  • Ability to build relationships and facilitate across a diverse group of stakeholders in several different business units
  • Additional experience within Pensions, Investments, and/or Commercial Real Estate sectors would be an asset

item.title: Business Systems Analyst
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

Why join us?

The Business Systems Analyst will join the dynamic Enterprise Data & Advanced Analytics (DNA) team within Data & Technology. DNA applies data, analytics and AI to develop scalable and appropriately governed solutions that drive sustainable growth at OMERS. The Business Systems Analyst will work alongside members of the DNA team and partner with the business to design, develop, implement, and scale data solutions that follow our data governance requirements (Data Classification, Data Retention, etc.).

You will work closely with our business and technology teams to support implementation of DNA’s strategic objectives and where possible, you will also identify advanced methods to simplify and automate our solutions. You will develop and nurture strong relationships with key governance partners (including Cybersecurity, Risk, Privacy) and also those within a variety of different business units across our global portfolio,  to elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage detailed functional specifications.


As a member this team, you will be responsible for: 

  • Liaising between business and technology teams to elicit, analyze, document and validate requirements for Data and Advanced Analytics products and solutions 
  • Defining detailed solutions in the form of detailed technical specifications/approaches for DNA products  
  • Ensuring data governance controls such as classification, retention, and disposition are appropriately considered in our products and solutions 
  • Providing hands-on support and technical expertise for product and solution implementation (e.g., implementation of Microsoft Information Protection Sensitivity Labels, retention labels in Microsoft 365, etc.) 
  • Supporting user adoption via the development and delivery of training and enablement activities  
  • Supporting DNA’s goal to remain on the leading edge of emerging data, analytics and AI technologies and techniques by identifying industry innovations and related data risk and compliance challenges  

To succeed in this role, you have:  

  • A degree in Computer Science, Data, Technology, or Engineering (or related experience) 
  • 3-5 years of experience as a business systems analyst with an emphasis on the implementation of data analytics and governance solutions (e.g., Microsoft Information Protection, Records Retention Labeling/Policies in Microsoft 365, Collibra, Informatica, Power BI Dashboards, data warehouses) 
  • Demonstrated experience partnering with business stakeholders to elicit and document requirement for complex data analytics and governance products 
  • Strong understanding of Microsoft 365 (SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive) including experience gathering technical requirements and hands-on experience in these tools. Experience implementing Microsoft Information Protection and retention labels is highly desirable. 
  • Demonstrated experience in modernizing data analytics and governance solutions via process engineering, automation, and other leading-edge approaches 
  • Excellent verbal and written communication to effectively articulate and communicate with both business and technical development teams  
  • Independent and motivated working style with a passion for learning new things 
  • A team player with a good understanding of the Agile methodology and Change Management best practices 

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. item.title: Senior Manager, Portfolio Engineering
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers.

At Oxford, our investment in building technology, a robust data pipeline and advanced analytics means that we are always improving, growing and doing things better. And as the Senior Manager, Portfolio Engineering, you will help make this happen!

As a technical expert in engineering and operations, you will provide strategic direction and tactical guidance on all operational matters within the portfolio. You will influence continuous improvement of regional engineering operations across the portfolio, development of tools for site teams and resources for consistent optimization, while supporting cost effective solutions, operational KPIs and customer comfort. Collaborating and working with colleagues you will be part of a team that leads innovation, efficiencies, and operational excellence across the portfolio.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

Product Innovation and Optimization

  • Support strategic initiatives where there will/should be meaningful impact to operational excellence

  • Support site teams with technical guidance and programming recommendations, especially as it relates to smart/digital building technology

  • Act as primary liaison with local utilities, identifying saving and ROI opportunities

  • Liaising with our corporate Platform Services to provide input to regional initiatives and corporate programs

  • Collecting and analyzing data to improve performance and customer outcomes, and to support advancement of optimization opportunities

  • Identify opportunities with 3rd party contractors to deepen relationship to support economies of scale and optimum service delivery

  • Research new technical innovations from within and outside of real estate, and advance leading-edge programs that align with business priorities and present business cases to support any recommendations

  • Establish protocol(s) to maintain consistent and on-going data acquisition / reporting for industry designations

Capital Projects and Construction

  • Provide technical leadership and management for the review, bidding and successful completion of engineering & operational related capital projects or other cost reduction initiatives

  • In partnership with the Construction & Design team, act as a resource to site teams to ensure correct protocols and Oxford standards are met including tendering and RFP processes

  • Actively support sales and property management teams, as needed

Compliance and Administration

  • Responsible for developing and executing formal program(s) to ensure all properties comply with building/operational regulatory requirements

  • Assist investment team with due diligence, IE physical property assessment / review of existing documentation, analyze final reports and make recommendations

  • Identify and drive streamlining of permitting and access of 3rd party partners

To succeed in this role, you:

  • Have a minimum of 7 years of operational experience in a high-rise commercial real estate.

  •  5 + years of experience managing engineering staff. This includes strong employee relation skills, leadership skills, coaching skills and training skills.

  • Have Power Engineering certification and/or possess a post-secondary degree or diploma in building science, mechanical or electrical engineering.

  • Smart building technology experience is a must and LEED AP, Energy Management certification (CEM), Facility or Systems training such as FMA, SMA via BOMA would be an asset.

  • Have experience completing business cases to support senior management decisions and managing approved projects from end to end.

  • Are an expert in electrical and mechanical systems including HVAC and life safety systems, energy auditing, mechanical, electrical, building sciences, construction processes and business administration.

  • Possess superior analytical skills with the ability to analyze large volumes of data, find trends, and make recommendations on strategic and tactical direction on operational matters without compromising customer comfort.

  • Have experience with the RFP process.

  • Strong business acumen and knowledge of customer service/service excellence trends.

  • Outstanding troubleshooting and analytical thinking to resolve issues.

  • Excellent interpersonal skills: able to build relationships and collaborating at all levels, with proven negotiations skills.

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Our story:

Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$70 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences and hotels; it spans more than 150 million square feet in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 100 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario\'s municipal employees.

For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

item.title: Senior Solution Architect
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

We are looking for a highly motivated and accomplished Solution Architect that is passionate about architecting scalable, secure and highly reliable solutions in a fast-paced agile environment. The Solution Architect will join our OMERS Corporate Business Relationship Management team in Toronto to engage, model and drive the organization to adopt leading practices, ensure strategic alignment between IT and Business, foster innovation and support business and IT strategies.


As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

  • Providing innovative approaches to create new solutions that contribute to the achievement of the organization’s targets and delivery of business outcomes
  • Designing innovative solutions using native cloud resources, translating business requirements and use cases defined through the Intake process into dynamic infrastructure capabilities that evolve as business needs change and additional cloud services become available
  • Developing infrastructure-as-code and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines to enable DevOps practices
  • Provide expert advice to teams on developing secure architectures, perform reviews, and document gaps while creating cloud security guidance & documentation
  • Defining architecture models and reusable solution design patterns that enable rapid deployment of cloud services for diverse business entities
  • Owning architectural responsibilities for all assigned project work, including stakeholder management, architecture requirements, analysis, business case development, budgeting, solution design, implementation planning, and deployment
  • Collaborating with stakeholders to gather functional and non-functional requirements for a specific project and facilitate trade-off discussions and resolution of conflicting requirements
  • Guiding, supporting and overseeing the implementation of documented solution architectures into operational platforms by engineering and operations teams
  • Incorporating security requirements into the design, understand and comply with OMERS security standards and policies
  • Providing direction and technical leadership in the adoption of new technologies and industry best practices
  • Developing and delivering strategic roadmaps to increase our cloud maturity, and provide subject matter expertise and governance as roadmaps are planned and executed
  • Building and communicating architecture plans, including future states and roadmaps, to all stakeholders including Business and Technology Leadership
  • Advising and supporting delivery teams on the use of patterns, capabilities, and complex technical issues
  • Influencing, negotiating and securing buy-in and understanding within the organization
  • Effectively and simply communicating complex concepts to business audiences
  • Reviewing functional and technical specifications to ensure the development of consistent solutions and minimization of technical debt
  • Creating internal and external partnerships to enable business success
  • Efficiently and diligently following OMERS technology governance processes to enable successful delivery of technology solutions
  • Ensuring that the solution architectures delivered by projects are fit for purpose and adhere to sound IT practices and to OMERS principles and standards
  • Researching and understanding industry trends and their applicability to support architectural plans and strategies for the enterprise
  • Supporting the Solution Architecture communities of practice
  • Mobilizing resources in the organization to create quick prototypes that demonstrate the art of the possible in the context of business needs


To succeed in this role, you have:

  • Minimum of 9+ years of progressive experience in the IT industry with strong knowledge of cloud architectures, deployment models (IaaS/PaaS/SaaS), various technology domains, application development practices and IT operations
  • 5+ years prior experience in a senior solution architect role, demonstrating the technical design and practical implementation of complex infrastructure solutions in an enterprise environment; financial sector experience is an asset
  • Excellent understanding and hands-on experience with Kubernetes, containerization, service mesh, cloud infrastructure and microservices architecture
  • Expert knowledge across technology architecture domains and practices; capable of driving end to end solution cycle from strategy to architecture to design & implementation
  • Experience with assessment, development, implementation, optimization, and documentation of a comprehensive and broad set of security technologies and processes (secure software development (Application Security), data protection, cryptography, key management, identity and access management (IAM), network security) within SaaS, IaaS, PaaS, and other cloud environments
  • A post-secondary degree in Math, Computer Science, Engineering, or similar
  • Expertise in GCP cloud IaaS and PaaS design, implementation and support, including connectivity, security, networking and disaster recovery
  • Proven experience in adopting and transitioning to cloud technologies from existing architectures
  • Experience with data and analytics architecture to enable BI Reporting, Analytics and AI/ML use-cases
  • Expert knowledge of solution delivery and software development practices (esp. Agile/Scrum), application release and deployment, and automated testing, including source code control, build / package, environment configuration and monitoring
  • The ability to work well at a conceptual level, resolve ambiguity, and to drive concepts into workable and practical solutions to achieve a target state
  • The ability to effectively identify emerging technologies, trends, standards and products that have a strong potential to better enable OMERS’ business units
  • Experience facilitating sessions, helping participants reach decisions and accomplish goals
  • Demonstrated leadership skills and ability to foster cross-team alignment
  • The ability to coach and support teams on architectural concepts and processes
  • The ability to lead and facilitate sessions
  • The ability to balance good enough architecture with actionable steps and targets
  • The ability to use verbal communication to disseminate complex concepts
  • The ability to write clear and succinct documents and to create engaging diagrams

Nice to have:

  • Certifications – Google Cloud Certified Professional Architect and/or Google Cloud Certified Associate Engineer, Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP), Certified Systems Security Professional (CISSP), CKA (Certified Kubernetes Administrator) and/or CKAD (Certified Kubernetes Application Developer), CCOAK (Confluent Certified Operator of Apache Kafka) and/or CCDAK (Confluent Certified Developer of Apache Kafka

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance.  Accordingly, employees are required to be fully vaccinated or have an approved exemption before attending OMERS and Oxford premises for work or for participating in in-person work events or work meetings.

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. 

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives. 

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance.  Accordingly, employees are required to be fully vaccinated or have an approved exemption before attending OMERS and Oxford premises for work or for participating in in-person work events or  work meetings.

item.title: Manager, Global Talent Acquisition Strategy
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

Reporting to the Director, Talent Acquisition, this role is responsible for consulting and collaborating with a broad range of stakeholders in support of the goals and objectives of Talent Acquisition.

Responsibilities will be in the design, development, delivery, and evaluation of global programs and services that support and build policies and processes to attract and retain top talent while promoting global consistency and alignment to strategic objectives. This role will lead the creation of global Talent Acquisition strategies and programs, with a mandate to: advance hiring practices (including assessments), design new sourcing and recruiting programs, prioritize the new-hire experience across OMERS, and strengthen and maintain a driven recruitment brand in the market with strong focus on the development of our Global Campus strategy.

Accountabilities:

Leadership

  • Lead and provide strategic and operational oversight to a team of direct reports to execute on recruitment strategies, ensuring a great candidate experience to drive higher quality candidates for the business to hire while establishing a talent pipeline for future needs

  • Act as an escalation point for Talent Acquisition and campus strategy queries, ensuring business and HR teams are aligning strategy with execution efforts

Global Campus & Strategy

  • Define global campus recruitment strategies and programs (e.g., collaborate with universities and strengthen reputation) ensuring the acquisition of strong pipeline talent into the organization; navigate the complexity of global markets and align to strategic workforce plans and our inclusion and diversity strategy

  • Create our global New Graduate programs, aligned to strategic workforce plans and our inclusion and diversity strategy; ensure best-in-class retention and exceptional new grad experiences

  • In partnership with People Analytics & Insights team, incorporate workforce data insights into program design and development, create targeted programs based on inclusion and diversity analysis, and develop strategies to monitor impact across the portfolio

Employee Value Proposition

  • Craft our global employee value proposition (EVP) and brand to showcase the value employees can expect to receive, including benefits, opportunities, and rewards

  • Develop social media engagement strategy and programs that align to our EVP and enhance our access to critical talent pools

  • Make recommendations and influence senior level stakeholders in support of building critical talent pools globally and enhancing our brand in the market

Assessments

  • Develop a global selection assessment strategy to target the right talent and capabilities, and contribute to a positive candidate experience (e.g., by leveraging artificial intelligence and gamification)

  • Evaluate the effectiveness, efficiency and new-hire experience of Talent Acquisition processes and identify required changes and updates

Vendor Management

  • Own the budget and vendor relationships for the portfolio; Source, approve, and maintain agency partnerships

Candidate Experience

  • Own the candidate experience, including onboarding, ensuring OMERS is leveraging best-in-class technologies and approaches

  • Continuously look to improve candidate, new hire, hiring manager and recruiter experience

  • Conduct industry research, keeping abreast of the latest news and trends of the recruitment world and providing analysis on the global talent market

Skills & Experience:

  • Undergraduate degree in Business, Human Resources, or a related discipline. 

  • Experience with leading a team of direct reports including coaching and mentoring

  • 8+ years of demonstrated successful experience in any combination of the following:

    • Full-cycle Talent Acquisition/campus recruitment

    • Employee value proposition/brand

    • Candidate experience, employee experience & onboarding programs/practices

    • New graduate/rotational programs

    • Social media strategy, and/or;

    • Talent assessments

  • Ability to adapt strategy and programs to a frequently changing, complex global context

  • Knowledge and experience working in a financial services organization and operating model 

  • Advanced knowledge of human capital trends and best practices 

  • Demonstrated learning agility and curiosity

  • Organization-wide program and project design, delivery and evaluation expertise 

  • Exceptional interpersonal skills to build collaborative relationships with, and influence, leaders at all levels of the organization

  • Highly skilled at coaching, facilitating, and presenting to a range of audiences 

  • Strong client-centered and service excellence approach 

  • Demonstrates strong self-awareness and self-management competencies aligned with organizational values 

  • Ability to deal effectively with competing and shifting priorities 

  • Experience with balanced scorecard performance indicators and metrics 

  • Advanced MS Office applications 

  • Proficiency in using Applicant Tracking Systems, preferably Workday

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. 

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

item.title: Application Developer, Risk Technology (6 Month Contract)
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

About Risk Technology:
Integrated with the Fund Investment Risk Management group, the Risk Technology team creates products that enables OMERS to make investment decisions rapidly and confidently. We work in tandem with clients across risk, capital markets and private markets to develop tailor made applications aligned to their decision-making needs. We also serve as translators across investments, technology and operations functions, instilling data governance and technology best practices across the organization.

About the Role:

You will be the lead application developer (full stack) on FIRM’s model management platform. As part of a revamp of OMERS Risk Infrastructure, the model management platform will be a critical application that documents and monitors the performance of the thousands of mathematical models employed in Risk’s quantitative analytics process. In this role, you will be working closely with the VP of Risk Technology and involved in a full application development cycle: from user journeys to go-live.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Working with users in risk, capital markets and operations teams; leading the documentation of user journeys and identifying application features.

  • Supporting the design and development of the application architecture – helping make key decisions on (but not limited to) the tech stack and data models.

  • As a backend developer (support), taking on development tasks including: the creation of models, views, business logic, test cases and API documentation.

  • As a frontend developer (lead), leading the development of visual components and client-side logic.

  • Developing scripts to consume and produce XML files to interface with the OMERS risk system.

  • Developers are expected to write succinct, efficient code that is easy to read and maintain.

  • Communicating requirements with partners in IT to deploy cloud infrastructure to house the application.

  • Developing deployment configurations (Docker, Kubernetes) to automate app deployment.

Qualifications  & Skills:

  • Demonstrated capability in full stack application development which can include:

    • A university or professional degree in computer science, programming, engineering or similarly quantitative discipline.

    • 4+ years experience developing client facing applications including both backend and frontend work.

  • Backend stack: Django, Django REST Framework, Postgres

  • Frontend stack: One of: Angular 2, Vue or React

  • Other tools/platforms: Docker, Linux VMs, Git.

  • ETL experience, working with XML files in Python

  • Basic knowledge of investments and financial instruments, including fixed income and derivatives. An understanding of their terms and conditions is a strong plus.

  • Experience working with investment, risk or trading datasets.

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

item.title: Student, Process Engineering (Summer 2022, 4 Months)
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers.

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll identify and implement process improvements that enhance experience and generate the right kind of cost saving initiatives. As a Process Engineer co-op, you’ll use your experience and direct feedback to improve the quality of key processes that impact our services. You’ll work closely with the teams and business and assist in the planning, development, and implementation of a process strategy that will build the operations team of the future.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for: 

  • Involving key business and IT stakeholders to clarify the process, document it and participate in process definition as well as for testing (User Acceptance post improvements) 

  • Assessing the process landscape, sorting processes by feasibility and potential for automation 

  • Estimating benefits for automation & perform capacity analysis 

  • Assessing current processes, identify areas of application for automation and document a comprehensive solution with help from SME’s 

  • Representing SRE team and liaison between technical personnel and non-technical personnel 

  • Involved in the technical design and solutioning 

  • Championing the usage and deployment of automation frameworks and act as a change agent in their adoption 

  • Communicating outcomes to promote Intelligent Automation and Business Process transformation 

 

This role is a combination of 40% process analysis, 40% technical writing and 20% reporting and analytics. 

 

How You’ll Succeed  

 

Leadership Skills – You will have knowledge of various facilitation techniques and be able facilitate meetings with large groups (10+) of stakeholders (with varying and conflicting opinions) to achieve desired outcomes  

 

Problem Solving – You think in structured way when solving problems and organizing work and can analyze data/situations fully and accurately to guide or reach productive decisions.  

 

Task Achievement – You have knowledge and understanding of Project Management tools, methodologies and principles and can plan, prioritize and organize work based on available resources/constraints.  

 

Interpersonal Relations – You will have excellent communication skills and will be able to communicate/present clearly and concisely using good examples or illustrations to explain things. You will have knowledge of various techniques to convince others and build support for process improvement recommendations.   

 

Who You Are 

You can demonstrate experience in applying process improvement techniques. You have strong knowledge in process and data analysis with advanced Excel skills. You are also a critical thinker who works well in a team environment. You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way. You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best. Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard. Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability. 

 

Must have 

  • Currently enrolled in a College or University program in Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Technology Management or related program 

  • Passion for excellence in IT Services and Automation 

  • Familiar with AGILE and Waterfall methodologies 

  • ITIL knowledge & experience 

  • Knowledge & experience working with managed services 

  • Superior analytical skills 

  • Knowledge of tools like Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Visio, Lucid charts, Power BI would be an asset 

 

Nice to haves 
Experience with Artificial Intelligence or machine learning based technologies 
In depth experience in the full lifecycle of automation solution implementation

Please include all required documents (Resume, Cover Letter, Unofficial Transcript, etc.) in one combined file. Your application may be submitted in PDF of Microsoft Word format.

item.title: Marketing Campaign Specialist
item.description:
Canvass AI, A Leader in Industrial AI, Seeks Marketing Campaign Specialist

Canvass AI is disrupting the industrial sector with its leading AI platform by enabling operators to scale the use of machine learning in their day-to-day production to gain immediate business benefits. Funded by Alphabet’s Gradient Ventures and Yamaha Motor Ventures, Canvass is democratizing access to AI by requiring little or no data science knowledge to use it. Global companies are employing Canvass AI today to achieve higher quality, lower cost, less disruption while reducing waste and emissions.

‍

Role:

As a Marketing Campaign Specialist you will be responsible for the marketing campaign operations of Canvass. Develop and execute Marketing campaigns to generate leads and increase demand funnel through-put. This position reports to VP-Marketing.

Location: Toronto, Ontario or remote

‍

Key Responsibilities:
  • Strategize, execute, and optimize a data-driven B2B demand generation campaign strategy to achieve sales goals for an assigned geographic or firmographic defined market segment.
  • Developing and deploying integrated marketing campaigns, including planning, aligning internal teams, developing audience segments, building email nurtures, owning top funnel virtual events, and measuring results on HubSpot
  • Apply an experimentation mindset to marketing campaigns to drive, test, learn, and optimize. Continuously conduct A/B testing across all channels
  • Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to build prescriptive persona-based buyer journeys as the foundation for campaign strategy
  • Work with internal and external team members to ensure proper messaging, timing, and execution of multi-channel campaigns

item.title: Machine Learning Engineer
item.description:
A Leader in Automating Intelligent Industrial Operations

At Canvass Analytics, we are disrupting the way industrial operational data is being used to make critical business decisions. Our disruptive, leading edge AI-powered analytics platform transforms plant operations, giving them predictive insights that enable autonomous operations.

Canvass AI software platform is empowering Fortune 1,500 industrial companies to transform industrial engineers into digital engineers who are driving data driven decisions in day to day operations. CanvassAnalytics’ customers include leading energy, manufacturing, food and ag, oil and gas, and metals and mining companies around the globe.

We’re an agile scale-up with the operational intelligence of a global business. As we accelerate rapidly, we are constantly looking for driven and ambitious innovators to join our team.

Things you should know about our product & teams
  • We don’t build machine learning pipelines to solve specific problems: we create pipelines that are able to solve classes of industrial data problems
  • We use Keras, SciKit-Learn,XGBoost, SHAP and regularly research and add new libraries to our stack
  • Our pipelines and micro services are developed predominantly with Python
  • We use Kubeflow to build flexible ML pipelines and Kafka for data pipelines
  • We use CircleCI to continuously test, integrate and deploy code changes, including ML
What we’re looking for:

We’re looking for candidates with:

  • Experience applying machine learning and deep learning algorithms to time-series problems
  • Strong knowledge of probability and statistics, plus a passion for working with data
  • The ability to implement feature engineering and data transformations at scale
  • Solid Python development skills, including experience with NumPy, Pandas and one or more ML libraries
  • An understanding of micro service architecture and containerization
  • A proven track record of delivering well-designed and tested software
​Who you are:

In general, we’re looking for engineers that exemplify these qualities:

  • Activation & Engagement Our engineers are critical to the progress of our application and our business. We expect our engineers to maintain focus on the business impact of their changes and advocate for work that will drive outcomes instead of just output.
  • Teamwork & Collaboration Our teams are small and extremely collaborative. You will work very closely with DevOps, ProductDevelopment and Customer Success to meaningfully impact the business every week.
  • Excellence & Craft Cloud infrastructure is more than just keeping the lights on 24/7. We need to build secure, scalable systems that are also easy to understand and easy to extend so that they can evolve with our business. We want our engineers to take pride in what they build.
  • Communication & Leadership An engineer can have a large impact by helping to grow the abilities and understanding of their teammates.We’re looking for people who can deliver learning sessions to introduce their technical teammates to new concepts and who can explain and contextualize their work to teammates outside of engineering.
Your Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • Awesome team and culture (every day)
  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Flexible office policy, with options to work remotely
  • Attend Conferences to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Company-provided MacBooks and standing desks
  • Top technology and tools to excel at your role
  • Free team lunches
Why Join Canvass?

Canvass Analytics is using AI to automate operations for theIndustrial sector. We are changing the way industry thinks and uses AI, and it’s getting noticed everywhere.  We’ve been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Startups and by Canadian Innovation Exchange asa Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company. Canvass is backed by Google’sGradient Ventures.

What\'s it like working at Canvass?

This is a place where everyone is all in. From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes. We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions. We have an inclusive culture.

Apply Now

Think this job is meant for you but worried you don’t have it all?If you feel you meet 70% of the qualifications listed and you are an innovative team player, express your interest here and we promise to consider your full profile.

You can also follow us on Twitter or LinkedIn to learn more about us.

Canvass Analytics welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

item.description:
A Leader in Automating Intelligent Industrial Operations

Canvass AI is disrupting the industrial sector with its cutting-edge AI platform, by transforming industrial engineers into data and digital engineers. Reporting to the VP of Marketing, you live and breathe product marketing and know the immense value this strategic function brings to an organization. Through your proven experience in B2B -SaaS product marketing, you have learned how to keep your eye on the big picture and execute on what needs to get done to move the needle.

We are looking for an experienced, collaborative, and driven Product Marketing Industry Lead, who will take Canvass AI to new heights and drive rapid growth across existing and new markets. You will be responsible for core go-to-market activism and ongoing product success - defining product positioning through a deep understanding of the market, buyers, and key competitors. You will synthesize information and serve as an internal and external evangelist and influencer to ensure the sales, marketing, and customer success are equipped with the right tools, knowledge, and information to properly position Canvass AI to win in the market.

Key Responsibilities

  • Conceptualize, build and analyze various marketing plans, strategies and campaigns to power the growth of Canvass AI’s brand and product.
  • Develop and launch campaigns to support our GTM (go to market) initiatives.
  • Develop targeted and meaningful content, product positioning and messaging that differentiates Canvass AI capabilities across the industry.
  • Communicate the value proposition of Canvass AI’s platform and capabilities to sales enablement and develop assets and sales tools that support the sales cycle.
  • Participate in the launch of new product releases and manage the cross-functional implementation of industry-agnostic plans.

  • Create and maintain a crystal clear and highly compelling product messaging matrix.

  • Track competitive marketing landscape against category.
  • Empower sales with competitive intelligence, and create and maintain competitor talking tracks, battle cards, cheat sheets, FAQs, and training.

Qualifications

  • Excellent communication skills a must; written and oral, including presentation and product demonstration experience to large and diverse audiences. You have a knack for developing compelling, differentiated, and memorable product narratives.
  • Analyst relations experience with firms such as Forrester and Gartner.
  • You enjoy collaborating with passionate cross-functional teams (e.g., sales, product management, marketing, customer success).
  • Roll up your sleeve get stuff done attitude with high growth start-up experience.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer
item.description:
Canvass AI is disrupting the industrial sector with its cutting-edge AI platform, by transforming industrial engineers into data and digital engineers. Backed by some of the world’s largest companies like Google’s Gradient Ventures, Canvass is democratizing the use of AI in day to day operations so industrial companies can build AI/ML models at scale and deploy them in production to gain business benefits in real time.

Things you should know about our tech:
  • ‍We use a microservices architecture built predominantly with Python
  • Our single-page web application is built with React and we use Django for our RESTful API layer
  • We use Kubernetes to manage our cloud deployments in Azure
  • We’ve built a data pipeline with Kafka and use Kubeflow to orchestrate our machine learning pipeline
  • We use CircleCI to continuously integrate and deploy code changes

‍What we’re looking for:

We’re looking for candidates with:

  • Experience building web applications with Python, bonus points for experience with a RESTful API framework
  • Experience using React (or other JavaScript frameworks) to build complex web applications
  • An understanding of microservice architecture and distributed system design
  • Proven track record of delivering well-designed and tested software
  • Solid understanding of relational and non-relational databases and best practices

In general, we’re looking for a senior developer that exemplify these qualities:

Activation & Engagement Our developers are critical to the progress of our application and our business. We expect our developers to maintain focus on the business impact of their changes and advocate for work that will drive outcomes instead of just output.

‍Teamwork & Collaboration Our teams are small and extremely collaborative. Developers work very closely with a small number of other developers, a designer, and a product manager to meaningfully impact the business every week.

‍Excellence & Craft Software development is more than checking features off a list of requirements. We need our developers to build systems that are accessible to new teammates and extensible so that they can evolve with our business. We want our developers to take pride in what they build.

‍Communication & Leadership A developer can have a large impact by helping to grow the abilities and understanding of their teammates. We’re looking for people who can deliver learning sessions to introduce their technical teammates to new concepts and who can explain and contextualize their work to teammates outside of engineering.

What’s in it for you

You want to join a company that’s at the forefront of leading edge technology and you want to be the person that takes us there and captures massive market share. You want to be part of an ambitious, successful team that is rapidly scaling up, that gives you room to grow and build your career as the company grows.  

Your Benefits

  • An incredible team with Inclusive culture, open to ideas
  • You build the future of the planet. An opportunity to work in a leading edge AI company that is making the planet safer and greener for the future.

This is a place where everyone is all in. From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes.  We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions. item.title: Content Writer (Data Science & Engineering) (Remote, Americas)
item.description:
About the role

We are looking for an experienced and creative Content Writer to join our Data Science & Engineering Programs team. You’ll work under the team’s brand and communication arm, responsible for building the Shopify Data brand both externally and internally. In this role, you’ll be responsible for writing and editing data-centric content that highlights the awesome work the team is driving forward. You’ll do this by working closely with Shopify data scientists and engineers to identify and craft stories for our blog, while also partnering with internal marketing teams to create and amplify technical-first content.

To be successful in this role, you must be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, writing technically, storytelling, being goal-oriented, managing multiple projects, and building relationships. You work well under pressure, understand what motivates data scientists and engineers, have a keen eye for great stories, and can both set and deliver on hard deadlines while simultaneously thriving in a changing environment. You are obsessed with taking technical content and transforming it into engaging stories.

If you love storytelling and are an experienced technical writer, join our team!

Responsibilities:

  • Write and edit technical, data-centred content for the Shopify Data blog 

  • Collaborate with internal marketing teams to create and review technical-focused marketing content (e.g. social copy, landing page copy, video scripts...)

  • Work closely with Shopify data scientists and engineers to identify and write key technical stories that we should be sharing externally

  • Create and manage a content funnel, intake process and strategy for data-centered stories

  • Build relationships across Shopify Data, Engineering, and Marketing

Qualifications

Requirements for the role:

  • Strong writing and editing skills based on past experience in a technical writing or editorial role

  • Exceptional storytelling skills and ability to identify interesting stories

  • Ability to quickly grasp the fundamentals of a technology and turn it into a long-form story, or distill it into a few words.

  • Can own the creation of a technical piece of content from intake interview with subject matter expert, to ideation, to final copy.

  • A commitment to understanding our data audiences’ needs 

  • Well-versed in building and managing a network of subject matter experts and stakeholders at multiple levels

  • High standards, an obsessive eye for detail, and a strong sense of ownership

  • Demonstrated ability to manage and deliver on deadlines

  • A self-starter who takes initiative and is excited to problem-solve

  • Proven ability to thrive on change

Bonus experience

  • Experience managing or writing for a technical blog

  • Background in data science or engineering

Top Drawer Challenge:

Choose your own adventure (choose one of the below):

  1. In 500 words, please write a post re-introducing the algorithm behind Shopify Capital. You should explain what Shopify Capital is and how data drives the product. Please spend no more than 1 hour on this!

  2. Go to our blog and find an article that you think could be made better with a few tweaks. Explain what’s missing, how the story could flow better or how you would write it differently. 

Application Timeline:

We know that applying to a new role takes a lot of work and we truly value your time. We are looking forward to reading your application. This posting will close on January 23rd.

item.title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer, Data Platform (Remote - Canada)
item.description:
About the role

Our Data Platform Engineering group builds and maintains the platform that delivers accessible data to power decision-making at Shopify for over a million merchants. We’re hiring high-impact developers for our Reliability group:

  • The Reliability group operates the data platform efficiently in a consistent and reliable manner. They are reliability engineers that build tools and infrastructure with other teams within the  Data Platform to leverage and encourage consistency. They champion reliability across shared platform infrastructure. Think DevOps for Data.

  • Data reliability engineers ensure that data flows through the platform on time and as expected. They ensure data services are performing according to service level objectives, that all systems have service level indicators, and if those systems fall below their objectives, recovery is swift. 

Qualifications

While our teams value specialized skills, they\'ve also got a lot in common. We\'re looking for a(n): 

  • High-energy self-starter with experience and passion for data and big data scale processing. You enjoy working in fast-paced environments and love making an impact. 

  • Exceptional communicator with the ability to translate technical concepts into easy to understand language for our stakeholders. 

  • Excitement for working with a remote team; you value collaborating on problems, asking questions, delivering feedback, and supporting others in their goals whether they are in your vicinity or entire cities apart.

  • Solid software backend engineer: experienced in building and maintaining systems at scale with reliability metrics as a default.

A Senior Data Developer at Shopify typically has 4-6 years of experience in one or more of the following areas:

  • Working with deployments of distributed computer engines (Spark, Presto, DBT, or Flink/Beam)

  • Measuring Query latencies, resource allocation and management, and data lake performance (Presto, SQL)

  • Cloud infrastructure (Google Cloud, Kubernetes, Terraform)

  • Modern Big-Data storage technologies (Iceberg, Hudi, Delta)

item.title: Data Science Manager (Remote, Canada)
item.description:
About the role

Data is a crucial part of Shopify’s mission to make commerce better for everyone. We organize and interpret petabytes of data to provide solutions for our merchants and stakeholders across the organization. From pipelines and schema design to machine learning products and decision support, data science at Shopify is a diverse role with many opportunities to positively impact our success. 

We are looking for Data Science Managers to join our Data Science teams and help shape the insights and algorithms that will inform our strategies as we grow globally.  

What your role will look like:

  • Partner closely with product, engineering and other RnD stakeholders to guide their decisions using data

  • Proactively identify and champion projects that solve complex problems across multiple domains

  • Apply specialized skills and fundamental data science methods (e.g. experimental design, recommender systems and machine learning when needed) to inform improvements to our business

  • Design and implement end-to-end data pipelines: work closely with stakeholders to build  models, tables or schemas that support business processes

  • Empower teams to build and maintain actionable KPIs, production-quality dashboards, informative deep dives, and scalable data products

 

Qualifications

You will need to have:

  • 7-10 years of commercial experience as in a data science role solving high impact business problems, including 3+ years leading and maintaining high performance data science teams
  • Experience building and managing high performance data science teams
  • Experience delivering business impact through analysis and data products
  • Experience building data pipelines and driving ETL design decisions
  • Technical leadership and management experience (you enjoy doing both).  You can jump into the code to the level that your direct reports admire and respect, but are also interested in developing people and capacity for your team
  • Experience creating data product strategies, shipping data products, iterating after launch, and trying again
  • Extensive experience using Python including a strong grasp of object oriented programming (OOP) fundamentals
  • Strong ability to prioritize and communicate to technical and non-technical audiences alike

It would be great if you have:

  • Previous experience using Spark (either via Scala or Pyspark)
  • Experience with statistical methods like regression, GLMs or experiment design and analysis, shipping productionized machine learning systems or other advanced techniques are also welcome
  • Experience with data storytelling using Tableau, QlikView, Mode, Matplotlib, D3, or similar data visualization tools

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

If you’re interested in helping us shape the future of commerce at Shopify, click the “Apply Now” button to submit your application. Please submit a resume and cover letter with your application. Make sure to tell us how you think you can make an impact at Shopify, and what drew you to the role. 

At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities. Please take a look at our Sustainability Reports to learn more about Shopify’s commitments to our communities, and our planet.

#LI-REMOTE

How we hire

At Shopify, we put a lot of care and time into who we hire. We believe that in order to build the best products, we need to build high impact teams. Our recruitment process centres around what we call the Life Story interview, a conversational-style interview where we get to learn more about you.
