item.title: Business Development Lead - Capital Markets
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for a critical problem solver who’s eager to help our machine learning research team deliver competitive products for RBC Capital Markets. As a member of our Business Engagement and Strategy team, you’ll be responsible for identifying exciting artificial intelligence research opportunities that will create outsized value for one of the bank’s lines of business. You’ll engage with our partners in the bank to develop strategic business plans to apply AI technologies to real-world problems, and you’ll collaborate with our product team to align business and technical stakeholders.

 

Our ideal candidate has an extensive working knowledge of capital markets and/or machine learning applications in finance, strong executive communication skills, and 2-5 years experience working in a financial institution. At Borealis AI, you’ll be joining a team that works directly with leading researchers in machine learning, as well as front office teams in Capital Markets. Our mission is to think big and go beyond what’s possible today to deliver competitive AI products. This is a rare opportunity to build the skills required to make machine learning work in the enterprise. You can find out more about our research areas at www.borealisai.com.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Becoming the Borealis AI expert on one or more RBC business lines;
  • Building relationships with RBC executives, subject matter experts, and technical teams;
  • Representing the business vision in the group’s product engagements and educating researchers on business needs;
  • Understanding Borealis AI research areas and creatively mapping technologies onto business problems;
  • Building and communicating strategic business plans, and collaborating with the Borealis AI research and product teams to ensure alignment, feasibility, and success; and
  • Defining and documenting business requirements and collaborating with the product and research teams to establish product scopes, test technical feasibility, and resolve any business issues that arise during product development.

You’re our ideal candidate if you have: 

  • Have front office experience in Capital Markets, Portfolio Management or a related field
  • Have working knowledge of data analytics and machine learning or a willingness to learn;
  • Have experience aligning new technologies to existing ones in large enterprises’ processes;
  • Have experience working in financial institutions;
  • Have experience developing relationships with senior and junior stakeholders at large enterprises;
  • Have experience developing business cases and other communications on technology projects;
  • Are a creative thinker who can develop long-term strategies as well as a stickler for detail on short-term commitments and deliverables;
  • Are excited to work with a machine learning research team on solving problems that cannot be solved with existing technology.

What’s in it for you? 

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable;
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities;
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.

 About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment 

RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

item.title: Data Engineer
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for an enthusiastic data engineer who’s excited by the opportunity of designing distributed systems to support applications at the forefront of machine learning technology. As a Data Engineer, you’ll be responsible for owning and delivering systems to efficiently acquire, prepare, and process data for state-of-the-art AI solutions that we build at Borealis AI.

 

Engineering plays a vital role at Borealis AI, turning our machine learning models into products that generate exponential business value. We understand the financial system we operate in, and we have the resources, knowledge and tools to improve it. Our team of 40+ engineers work with leading Machine Learning researchers to accelerate, build and deploy products that will enhance risk applications, reduce fraud, help millions of people manage cash flow, access credit and plan for their financial futures. In the finance sector, millions of people are counting on us to get it right.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Design and build data pipelines for Borealis AI projects;
  • Build efficient data systems and abstractions for Borealis AI projects;
  • Collaborating with research, engineering and business teams to model and deliver on their data needs.

You\'re our ideal candidate if you:

  • A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent. A master’s or PhD in an AI sub-field is an asset;
  • Strong enterprise experience in designing and building data lakes;
  • Solid understanding of distributed computing frameworks (i.e. Spark, Hadoop) as well as SQL, NoSQL and graph databases;
  • 3+ years of software development experience in a high-responsibility, minimal-supervision environment;
  • Strong experience with writing modular, robust, scalable software in one of the major languages such as C++, Java, Python 3.x;
  • Strong experience with the Unix command line and bash scripting;
  • Strong communication skills and a collaborative attitude.

What\'s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable;
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities;
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.

About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

item.title: DevOps Engineer
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for an experienced Dev/Ops Support Engineer who will bring focus and subject-matter expertise around designing, implementing and supporting machine learning infrastructure and automation tools in production. This is a unique opportunity to grow in the world of machine learning infrastructure and work with a team of passionate individuals committed to the mission of bringing ML to enterprise.

 

At Borealis AI, you’ll be joining a team that works directly with leading researchers in machine learning, has access to rich and massive datasets, and offers the computational resources to support ongoing development in areas such as reinforcement learning, unsupervised learning and computer vision. You can find out more about our research areas at borealisai.com.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Providing production support and maintenance for ML applications;
  • Designing, building, and optimizing machine learning deployment tools and automation systems that operate the business’s data and ML applications;
  • Collaborating with engineers, and machine learning researchers to automate code analysis, build, integration and deployment of ML applications;
  • Supporting applications and projects with infrastructure design decisions, and monitoring solutions;
  • Building highly scalable, resilient cloud and on-premise systems for hosting machine learning systems using state-of-the-art technologies;;
  • Providing after-hours production support.

You\'re our ideal candidate if you have:

  • Strong experience with Site Reliability Engineering, DevOps and production support;
  • Strong and relevant experience supporting and maintaining distributed systems;
  • Hands-on experience building and deploying virtualized environments in major cloud environments, such as Kubernetes, AWS and Azure;
  • Experience with building tools and applications to automate various infrastructure tasks (Jenkins, etc.);
  • Proficiency with programming languages such as Python, Bash, or JavaScript;
  • Experience implementing monitoring solutions to identify system bottlenecks and production issues;
  • Solid understanding of the UNIX operating system.

It would be great if you also have:

  • Knowledge of the machine learning application deployment process;
  • Knowledge of professional software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle, including testing methods, coding standards, code reviews and source control management;
  • Familiarity with machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras, Theano, and/or similar.

What\'s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable;
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities;
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.

About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

item.title: Group Product Manager
item.description:
Available Locations
Toronto

What\'s the opportunity?

As a Group Product Manager on the Product team, you’ll get a chance to lead a portfolio of innovative AI products for the financial services industry and lead a team of machine learning product managers. You and your team will be responsible for building and delivering products that solve high-impact business and for defining strategic product roadmaps for your portfolio with the support of the business development, engineering, and research teams.

 

At Borealis AI, you’ll be joining a team that works directly with leading machine learning researchers and software developers. Our mission is to think big and go beyond what’s possible today to deliver competitive AI products. This is a rare opportunity to build the skills required to make machine learning work in the enterprise. You can find out more about our research areas at www.borealisai.com.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Leading a portfolio of machine learning products within Capital Markets;
  • Defining and executing on both short and long-term product strategy and roadmaps;
  • Managing and developing a team of machine learning product managers;
  • Building and maintaining relationships with technical senior stakeholders within RBC Capital Markets;
  • Defining and delivering POCs and scaling these out into full-fledged products;
  • Guiding ideas from discovery-to-development-to-deployment in the Capital Markets Environment.

You\'re our ideal candidate if you:

  • You have 7+ years of experience working in capital market or a product role and 3 + years of management experience;
  • You have Master’s, or PhD degree in a technical or quantitative field;
  • You have strong product leadership skills and the ability to own a portfolio of products end-to-end independently. You have a track record of successful product deliveries;
  • You have strong foundations in finance and experience in global markets;
  • You are well versed with the core areas of applied machine learning and have experience with machine learning platforms and deploying models at scale;
  • You are an experienced people manager who can lead a high-performing team and ensure their continued development;
  • You are a strong collaborator and have the ability to influence both technical and business stakeholders;
  • You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamics environment.

item.title: Machine Learning Engineering Lead
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for an Engineering Manager to lead our Equities Returns Prediction team, being at the forefront of machine learning technology and working on extremely challenging problems. 

 

As a Machine Learning Engineering Lead, you’ll be responsible for owning and delivering a project end to end – everything from data pre-processing to implementing machine learning training pipelines and deploying inference in a production environment. You’ll be directly managing a team of machine learning engineers, responsible for strategic planning, execution and delivery. You will provide your team with technical leadership and mentorship. You will work along other engineering leads across Borealis AI. As a people manager you will be responsible for growing your team and fostering career growth of the engineers. 

Your responsibilities include:

  • Lead and directly manage a team of 4 engineers, being responsible for planning execution and delivery of ML systems; 
  • Establish high standards and share knowledge in performance, scalability, enterprise system architecture, and engineering best practices; 
  • Establish and maintain collaboration with research and business teams to converge on the best solutions; 
  • Extending prototypes into fully functional, polished solutions ready for internal and/or external use; 
  • Grow and develop the team, helping each team member advance in their career. 

You\'re our ideal candidate if you:

  • Have 7+ years of experience delivering software projects to production; 
  • Have experience managing a team of engineers; 
  • Have experience developing modular, robust, scalable software in a modern programming language; 
  • Experience working with business, product and other technical teams; 
  • Experience with scaling and performance of large systems; 
  • Have led the full lifecycle of software product development including the successful deployment of products to production; 
  • Experience taking a leading role in building complex software products, fostering career growth of software engineers, and establishing software engineering best practices within your team; 
  • Have background in machine learning or a related field; 
  • Experience with Capital Markets or any financial domain is a big plus. 

What\'s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;

item.title: Machine Learning Researcher
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity?

As a Machine Learning Researcher, you’re looking to channel your love of playing with real-world data into industry-disrupting solutions. We\'re a lab that supports research on a wide variety of theoretical and applied machine learning projects. Working in our lab will grant you unique access to massive structured and unstructured datasets with the tools and resources necessary to build game-changing statistical models.

 

Being part of our team means you’ll also have the opportunity to publish original research in peer-reviewed academic journals and participate in conferences around the world, such as NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML, CVPR and more.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Developing novel AI solutions that facilitate impactful products;
  • Conducting original, publishable research by advancing the state-of-the-art in machine learning techniques;
  • Working with the development team to transfer research work into production;
  • Interpreting larger organizational needs and designing algorithmic solutions that can drive the next generation of banking experiences;
  • Identifying relevant new AI technologies as they become available, and disseminating them into the bank’s technology capabilities.

You’re our ideal candidate if you have:

  • A passion for solving open problems using data and algorithms;
  • A PhD in a sub-area of AI or demonstrated research track record by means of publications and/or sophisticated AI product experience;
  • Ability to formulate and drive a research project independently without close supervision;
  • Proficiency in Python and Deep Learning packages such as Tensorflow or PyTorch.

What’s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable;
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities;
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.

item.title: Machine Learning Researcher - Time Series
item.description:
What\'s the Opportunity?

Capital markets are known for their complex dynamics and intricate dependencies. As a Machine Learning Researcher in our capital markets team, you’re looking to channel your love of playing with real-world data into industry-disrupting solutions. Our team supports research on a wide variety of theoretical and applied machine learning projects, including game-changing studies on dynamic interactions between statistical models operating on a common source of data.

 

Working in capital markets will grant you unique access to massive structured and unstructured datasets with the tools and resources necessary to drive your vision. Being part of our team means you’ll also have the opportunity to publish original research in peer-reviewed academic journals and participate in conferences around the world, such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, AISTATS and more.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Developing novel AI solutions that facilitate impactful products;
  • Conducting original, publishable research by advancing the state-of-the-art in machine learning techniques;
  • Working with the development team to transfer research work into production;
  • Interpreting larger organizational needs and designing algorithmic solutions that can drive the next generation of banking experiences;
  • Identifying relevant new AI technologies as they become available, and disseminating them into the bank’s technology capabilities.

You’re our ideal candidate if you have:

  • A PhD in a sub-area of AI or demonstrated research track record by means of publications;
  • A passion for solving open problems in areas such as time-series analysis, generative modelling, graph-based architectures, or multi-agent systems;
  • Proficiency in Python and Deep Learning packages such as Tensorflow or PyTorch.
  • An eye for efficiency and experience with large-scale optimization on large-scale data.
  • [Bonus] Familiarity with C++ and network programming.
  • [Bonus] Familiarity with market microstructure, alpha research, or game theory.

item.title: Technical Product Manager
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity?

Be a part of Borealis AI\'s success in delivering innovative products for RBC and pushing the boundaries in AI/ML product development. We are building a state-of-the-art ML platform that scales our team\'s ability to create, train and deliver trusted AI. You will be chiefly responsible for ensuring that this platform meets the needs of our internal customers and achieves broad adoption, working closely with engineering teams to deliver and iterate on the platform as we grow.

 

In addition, you will apply your previous expertise in Product Management & Ownership and ML Development to make the platform a highly successful product that accelerates teams within Borealis and with teams across RBC in their AI solution development. We\'re looking for a bold, tenacious, curious, and creative hands-on leader with proven experience at the intersection of Platform Product development and ML to join a highly talented team driving Borealis AI to be a leader in financial services AI. 

Your responsibilities include:

  • Working collaboratively with software, data, and infrastructural engineering teams to develop, prioritize, and maintain the feature backlog to deliver Borealis AI\'s Common Platform.
  • Working collaboratively with the Common Platform target users, Borealis AI product teams mix ML Software Engineers and AI Researchers to develop and maintain the product roadmap and strategy.
  • Form and maintain deep trusted relationships with RBC enterprise ML platform initiatives and the larger ML practitioner user groups, lines of business, functions, subject matter experts, delivery partners, architects, technology vendors and collaborating teams to grow the project\'s impact and scale of Borealis AI MLOps technology to RBC more broadly. 
  • Represent the voice of the end-user, and act as the authority on confirmed-value feature prioritization and feature acceptance.
  • Develop and execute the operational strategy for delivering the product management of the Common Platform itself. As part of this, drive and contribute to resource allocation, build vs buy strategic decisions, product marketing internal and external, and overall team performance, cohesion, and health. 

You’re our ideal candidate if you have: 

  • Demonstrable hands-on experience in the development of ML models, ideally with experience across both premise and cloud-based architectures. Specialist training in data science, ML or associated domains such as Computer Science.
  • Demonstrable experience in Product Management and Product Ownership.
  • Knowledge of and experience with one or more vendor or open-source MLOps platforms, and general familiarity with the challenges of developing, deploying and managing ML models.
  • Experience in leading without authority to garner the support and participation of colleagues across matrixed organizations.
  • Deadline-driven, organized and results-oriented; able to meet consistently high-quality standards while simultaneously handling various tasks and deadlines. They are motivated, driven and proactive but with a supportive and empathetic mindset.
  • Experience in driving team success through the continual development of exceptional OKRs.

Nice-to-have:

  • Post-graduate degree in Computer Science or other relevant technical disciplines.
  • Certified training in Agile and Scrum disciplines.
  • Experience in the application of Artificial Intelligence technologies in financial services sector products
  • Experience in the development of platform technologies to unlock an exceptional developer\'s experience. 

What\'s in it for you?

  • Opportunity to play a vital role in the development of leading-edge products.
  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach our full potential.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and management opportunities.
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • Flexible work/life balance options.
  • Opportunities to do challenging, groundbreaking work.

item.title: Technical Recruiter
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity? 

Borealis AI’s mission is to be a leader in AI for financial services and world-class talent is at the heart of this vision.  We are looking for an experienced Technical Recruiter to support our recruitment objectives, including creatively sourcing, managing the candidate lifecycle, and closing candidates.

 

This is a great opportunity for someone looking to gain experience in a cutting-edge industry of AI/ML, who wants to be part of an innovative organization. You will have the opportunity to partner with hiring managers across our labs, working together
to find the best talent to support us in achieving our goals. Our team believes in being Bold & Curious, so we are looking for someone who is creative, eager to learn and looking to make an impact!

Your responsibilities include:

  • Partnering with business leaders and hiring managers to assess their talent requirements and advising on the best hiring strategy; 
  • Using a variety of techniques to discover and attract the best passive talent; 
  • Conducting interviews and phone screens to assess both technical baseline, as well as skills to be successful in the Borealis AI environment; 
  • Focusing on providing a great candidate experience at every opportunity; 
  • Constantly evaluating our processes and pipeline to ensure we are fairly evaluating candidates;   
  • Ensure the ATS (Greenhouse) and recruitment reporting is regularly updated to aid with metrics i.e. sources, agency against direct, time to hire, time to offer, average cost per hire, etc; 
  • Drive specific D&I activity/initiatives for recruiting by upskilling hiring managers on best practice and ensuring data is tracked successfully.

You’re our ideal candidate if you have: 

  • Minimum of 2+ years of technical recruiting experience; 
  • Demonstrated track record of excellence in sourcing and assessing technical talent; 
  • Proven relationship management experience with hiring teams and internal stakeholders, helping them navigate the sources of talent, and assisting them with assessment; 
  • Skilled in offer negotiation, awareness of pertinent employment legislation, and employment market trends; 
  • The ability to lead requisitions to successful conclusion – balancing efficiency with quality; 
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills; 
  • A genuine interest in the technology industry as shown by continuous learning throughout your career; 
  • Experience in a start-up, fast-paced environment;   
  • Experience with engineering, research and product roles would be a benefit. 

What’s in it for you? 

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential; 
  • Freedom to take initiative; 
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities; 
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale. 

About Borealis
